loans.name: Elmo

texts.en:
Elmo P. is from the village of Puntod. He is 42 years old and is married.

Elmo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elmo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Elmo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be his 2nd from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia O. is from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz. She is 49 years old. Lilia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom T. is 24 years old and a married mother who cares for two children who are pupils in the local public school. Prom T. is a rattan cupboard seller. Since 2008, she and her husband have owned a small rattan cupboard sales point. In addition to their daily income, the couple also orders a variety of other miscellaneous crops to store for a while before selling to make a profit. Prom T. will use this loan to purchase rice and green beans for resale. The loan will provide her with additional revenue, which she will use to ensure that her family has a decent standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice and green beans for resale

loans.name: Urch

texts.en:
Urch A., aged 31, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is making and selling rattan cupboards. She sells rattan that she weaves or she orders it from other weavers who live in the village. Urch's husband's job is another source of family revenue. He operates a trailer-motor taxi.
Urch A. has received orders for rattan from customers but she has no capital to meet these orders. To fulfill the orders, Urch A. has decided to seek a Kiva loan, which she will use to buy rattan to satisfy her customers' requirements.

loans.use: To buy rattan

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely J. is from the village of Unidos. She is 62 years old and is widowed with three school-aged children. Fely owns and operates a business cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 1999, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Fely is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase land to raise additional crops. This loan will be her 17th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Saingerel

texts.en:
Saingerel, B. is a humble, helpful and open-minded person. She is lives with her husband and one-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Saingerel has been operating a taxi business since 2005 and, after the birth of her daughter, her husband helps in the business.

Saingerel enjoys transporting people. She says, “I must be very responsible and careful when driving my car in order to provide a safe ride for my customers.” Also she says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children."

Saingerel is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma G. is from the town of Leon B. Postigo. She is 52 years old and is married with six children. Three of them are already married while the other three are still in school. Norma works in someone else's business operating a specialized retail store selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Uong

texts.en:
Uong E. is a 44-year-old widow and mother. She lives with her son in her own small family home in Kompong Tom Province.

Uong E. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land such as cabbages, morning glories, and especially rice for both eating and selling. Her son helps be responsible for the family by working in the construction sector.

The rain has beE. coming down and the conditions are good for planting. However, Uong E. doesn’t have money to use on her farm field. Therefore, she is applying for a loan in order to buy seed, fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for pumping water.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for pumping water

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena A. is from the village of Tigbao. She is 45 years old and is married with two adult children. Elena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila P., from the town of Siayan, is 38 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a specialized retail store selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to buy corn and rice to sell. Mila plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Pil

texts.en: Pil S. is a 34-year-old rice and vegetable grower from the Kompong Tom Province. She runs her business on her own farmland, where she grows different kinds of crops like cabbage, rice, and morning glories. She will sell the crops to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work. Pil S. has three school-aged children. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. However, Pil S. does not have enough farm supplies to use on her field. Pil S. is therefore asking for capital to use toward purchasing fertilizers, seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Muon

texts.en: Mrs. Muon N. has been spending her life growing crops. Muon N. needs money to use on the farm during the coming rainfall, which is good for farming. She is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.  Muon N. currently lives with her husband who works in the farm fields frequently alongside her and they both have three school-aged kids.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Mrs. Um Y. is 60 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she has established a medium family home and earns a living as a local farmer. She is married to Mr. Yin Yim, age 58, who works with her in the farming business. This couple has nine children, six of whom are now married and have already started new family homes, while the others are single. 

Due to the coming rainy season, which is when conditions are good for planting rice, Um Y. has requested a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and bean seeds to grow on her own farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and bean seeds to grow on her own farmland

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun N., age 32, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards and wooden beds. She sells rattan that she and her husband produce or that they order from other makers who live in the village. 

Bun N. uses her cow cart as transportation and it takes a week to sell all her items. Recently she lacks enouigh cash to buy raw materials to make more of her products to satisfy the needs of her customers, so she has applied for assistance through Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make more of her products to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat S. was born in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is 35 years old. She was born into a low-income family and after the divorce of her parents, she grew up at her grandmother’s house. Saltanat graduated from secondary school, but could not continue her studies because she had to help her grandmother around the house. She milked cows, pastured the cattle and cultivated land. 

Saltanat got married at the age of 22 and soon she gave birth to a son.  After an unfortunate family life and the death of her grandmother, she moved to Kara-Balta town, near the capital city of Bishkek. In order to get income, Saltanat decided to start up her own business.  Using the capital of 10,000 KES, she bought a supply of electrical appliances to resell, which she sold at a local market. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to her strong efforts. 

She managed to multiply her investments and raised her circulating capital to 70,000 KES. In 2004, Saltanat got married in second time and gave birth to two sons. One son is now four years old and the second is a breast-fed infant. 
 
Saltanat plans to use the loan of 50,000 KES to broaden her business by expanding the range of products she sells. With the revenue from this investment, she plans to open one more selling place at the market.  Speaking of her plans for the future, she dreams of buying a minivan. 


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden assortment of goods

loans.name: Tosondalay

texts.en:
Tosondalay G. has been running her tailoring business for four years quite successfully, and has her own customers. She employs one other person. Before she started her own business she used to work in a dressmaking factory as a quality controller. Then the factory was shut down. 

She's 35 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage boys, aged 15 and 17.  Because of the increased demand from her customers, she is planning to expand her business by opening another branch. 

Her husband is a veterinarian and most of the time he is away on business trips to the countryside. They currently don't have their own home and are living in her mother's house. She is asking for a loan of 800,000 MNT, and is planning to spend 600,000 MNT to buy a new sewing machine and 200,000 MNT for the first month's rent on a new place.  

She is a very hard working person and has a good credit history. Her main goal is to provide a good education for her two children.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Vaing

texts.en:
S., 55 years old, owns a small wooden house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets, soft drinks and gasoline. She retails her inventory to people who are passers-by and are also her neighbors living near her house. She has been running a grocery business for a long time and earns an average of $8 a day. 

She normally receives help from her husband who buys the items for her to sell in her store. The couple is blessed with six children, half of whom are already married and the others are single. 

S. dreams of having her own vehicle to provide her with business transportation or for traveling anywhere, but her dream hasn't come true because of lacking funds to buy one. Because of this, she has decided to ask for a loan of $1100 to be used to buy a secondhand motorcycle, as well as to accumulate a quantity of groceries for her store.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mung

texts.en:
Mung H., 58, is a village woman living in Phnom Penh. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. She was married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has five children who live together in the family home. 

To help meet the family's daily expense needs, two of her daughters work sewing clothes in the garment factory. She has one son who is no longer in school and is unemployed. She wants to encourage him to be a motor-taxi driver, but it requires some capital. That is why Mung H. is aplying for an $1100 loan from Kiva in order to buy a motorcycle for her son to start providing taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Richard Kipngetich

texts.en:
Richard has been farming for the last six years in Naivasha town.  He is 34 years old, married to Mary Jelangat and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to start practicing mixed farming and with this cash, he plans to buy cows which he will rear for both meat and milk production.  

His future plan is to have a big animal farm where he will rear a variety of animals for wholesale production of both meat and milk.

loans.use: To buy cows to rear

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: Mrs. Moun R., age 46, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that she buys from fishermen. She has a life partner in her husband who is skilled at making ox-carts and he currently uses his knowledge to earn a living. The couple has given birth to six children who are single and are employed. Moun R. requested a loan for her husband to use to improve his ox-cart making service.

loans.use: To improve her husband's ox-cart making service.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his mother and one brother. After the death of his father, he took the responsibility of meeting the family expenses. As with the majority of the Lebanese men, his story illustrates the day-to-day challenges in working hard to support their families with their business income. He has been working as a car electrician for almost eight years. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools for his business. In the future, he hopes to continue expansion of his business. He expects the coming year to be successful and to further increase his business productivity.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Micro-finance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Micro-finance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase additional tools

loans.name: George Ngigi

texts.en:
George has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for thirteen years.  He is 35 years old, married to Eunice Wangeci, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan.  He paid his first loan of 40,000 KES well and on time.  He wants to use the funds from this loan to buy more clothes to sell.  

George plans to move to a more permanent place from which to sell his clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Grace Saritei

texts.en:
Farming has been part of Grace's life for the last twenty-three years.  Apart from farming as a hobby she also sells her crops in the nearby market.  She is 42 years old and has eight school-going children.  She has taken care of them alone since her husband died.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 2nd loan.  She cleared her first loan of 30,000 KES on time.  She now wants 50,000 KES which she will use to buy more seedlings to plant.

Grace hopes to open a green grocery where she will sell part of her harvest and different vegetables from her farm.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng K., age 64, is a single mother of six children, all of whom are already married and are employed at different occupations. Most of her children have provided their income to meet the family's expenses. Leng K. is a domestic rice trader who owns many plots of farmland next to her house. On her land, she plants various crops to earn a living. 

Leng K. has been planning to construct a new house on another part of her village land for her married children to live in; however, she cannot achieve her goal because she lacks the necessary funds. To help with this, Leng K. has decided to take out a loan in the amount of $1100 to add to her savings in order to build a new house. Mrs. Leng K. was not available when the photo taken so her daughter is pictured instead.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 30-year-old single lady with two children: Tiffany Mwihaki, 5, and Jerome Katuse, 3, who are both in school.  She grows and sells vegetables to earn income for supporting the family.  She mainly supplies carrots, vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and fruits.  She has been in this business for two years.    

She was previously employed and decided to go into business so as to earn enough income to support her family.  Since she joined Pambazuko group in Faulu Kenya, she has acquired business skills.  This is because the group members share business ideas during their group meetings.  Besides, the members of the group also guarantee each others' loans.  

She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES which she will use to expand her business.  She hopes to buy a car for transporting fruits and vegetables.  She describes herself as a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Lucy Apetet

texts.en:
Lucy has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for two years now.  She is 36 years old, married to William Miyuon, and they have four children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 2nd loan.  She paid her first loan of 24,000 KES on time.  She plans to use the cash from this loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Lucy plans to open a big clothes boutique in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old widow woman. She has three children. After the death of her husband, she found herself alone taking the responsibility for her children. As a result she decided to work in the occupation she knows, so she established a tailoring business in her home in 2000. With her business income, she was able to support her family. Now her children are starting to work and they help their mother to satisfy the heavy demands of their life.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase tailoring supplies and additional textiles to produce a variety of products for her clientele so as to earn more income.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Micro-finance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Micro-finance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free Kiva loans to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchase tailoring supplies and additional textiles

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is 33 years old and married.  He is blessed with two children: Josephine, 9, and Stephen, 6 years old.  He sells milk to earn a living.  

He appreciates Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to keep business records.  Currently, he is able to run his business well and has employed one person.  He has nine years of experience in the business.  He is also employed in a restaurant.  He was previously operating a retail shop.  

He wants to take out his first loan of 20,000 KES to increase his stock and to purchase a bicycle for delivering milk.  He hopes to buy a car for transporting milk in the future.  In ten years, he wants to expand his shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To increase his stock and purchase a bicycle for delivering milk

loans.name: Juddy

texts.en:
Juddy is a 31-year-old married lady with two children.  She has been selling flowers for decoration for five years and has employed two people.  

She is a member of Vijana group under Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each others' loans.  She previously took out a loan from Faulu Kenya which she used to boost her business.  She has requested for another loan of 40,000 KES to buy more flowers to resell.  

She hopes to own real estate in the future.  She dreams of owning many business outlets in ten years.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alima Mohammed

texts.en:
Alima has operated her grocery shop for five years, selling fruits and vegetables to her neighbors.  She is 47 years old, married to Alio Edin, and they have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid her previous loans well and on time, 10,000 KES and 20,000 KES respectively.  

She plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her shop, and include other retail products like sugar, maize and wheat flour, milk, detergents and cereals.

loans.use: To expand her shop and add stock of cereals, maize flour, sugar and detergents to sell

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a married man with seven children.  Three are still in school.  He has been operating a retail shop for five years. He also does farming to supplement his family’s income. 

He has been a member of Faulu Kenya in a group called Maarifa.  The members of the group are accountable for any member who takes out a loan.  In the group, he also gets the opportunity to save his money on a weekly basis. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and sweets.  He hopes to have a decent house in the future. In ten years, he wants to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and sweets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Mr. B. has spent his entire life fishing in and around the river. He owns a boat for traveling to the middle of the river where he frequently fishes. After fishing, he hurries to bring the fish to sell at retail prices in the local market. B. said that fishing is an annual operation with which he has had great success for several years. 

His wife is a good homemaker who arranges a daily routine and also sells a few vegetables for a profit. The couple are determined parents of five kids. Three of them are employed and the other two attend school. 

B. will use his first loan to buy a vehicle to provide transportation for the family. This will help him to cut down on traveling fees.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily T. is from the village of Carinugan, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emily buys and sells rice by the kilogram. She also runs a mini store in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $200 a month from these activities.

Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional rice to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn T., from the village of Mamanga, is 35 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn owns and operates a business making and selling dried goods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2003, Emelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Emelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn C., from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz, is 31 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Anelyn owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Anelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she is now requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be Anelyn's fourth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: A widow and mother, 51-year-old Moun M. resides with four teenage children in Kdol village in Battambang Province. Here she owns another piece of farmland, on which she plants different kinds of crops to earn a living. Another source of family income is from her daughter who sells sugar cane juice. Moun M. and her kids currently live in an older house that needs repairs frequently. Because of this reason, Moun M. is applying for a loan to use towards repairing her old house.

loans.use: To use towards repairing her old house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has two young children who attend school. He is the main provider for his family with his business income. He has owned a car painting shop in his town since 1990. During this long period, he has gained good experience and a good reputation in this field. He is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his capital to improve and expand his business. In the future, he is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell spare car parts

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase his capital to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina S., from the village of Carinugan, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City, is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business providing recycling services. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling junk and other recycled materials in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional scrap metal to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap metal to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Loep

texts.en:
Loep L. is a single mother caring for three children. All three of them attend the local school and are dependent on her income. She was married years ago but divorced her husband. She is a sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn money to ensure her children attain the highest level of education.

To earn a living, she sells fresh beef to people who are passers-by in the village. This is the second loan she has requested. Loep L. will use this loan to mend her old house that has broken down frequently.

loans.use: To mend her old house.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy T. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 49 years old, married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2000, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Daisy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 50-year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his two old parents and he takes care of them. He has more than 25 years experience working in car electric repair. His shop is situated in his town and he is known by the neighboring towns also. He ensures the household expenses are paid for sick and aging family members. He was able, over the years, to enlarge his business and create a good base of clients asking for his services. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,000 to purchase new electric tools and supplies instead of the used ones. He’s sure that with the new equipment he will be able to deliver his services faster and take more work. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). loans.use: purchase new electric tools and supplies

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen Y. currently makes rattan furniture. She is 58 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She has five children: three are married and two are single. Pen Y. saves up over 10 sets of rattan and then sells them to her customers for profit. Usually, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband helps her transport the finished products directly to customers' houses. Pen Y. has son who want to go to university but he lacks funds to pay tuition. Pen Y. will be using this loan to better meet the requirements of her son.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is from the village of Unidos. She is 62 years old. Remedios is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Sok S.. She is 47 and lives in the province of Battambang in Cambodia, about 300 km from Phnom Penh along National Road No. 5. Sok S. earns a living by planting vegetables. She grows them both for eating and selling. Her husband works with her in the field. This couple has given birth to five kids who are in school. Sok S. lives in an older house that is often broken down, and their living situation has been affected. Sok S. is, therefore, asking for a loan to repair the house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 55-year-old married man from Lebanon with four children. He has owned a mini-market in his village for the past 12 years. He sells in his grocery shop all types of food products, dairy products, juices, soft drinks, beads etc. His shop is situated in a busy area so there are a good number of customers passing by his shop. This is his second loan requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He has been very reliable with his repayments. He is requesting a larger loan amount of $2,000 to increase his shop inventory to be prepared for the coming holidays in Lebanon where the selling rate will be increased. He’s very optimist about the results.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

loans.use: To increase his shop inventory

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a single lady who currently lives with her old mother and other two relatives. To pursue a daily income, S. works in the construction field. In her free time, she also helps her mother sew clothes for extra profit.

 The roof of the family house is cracking since the heavy rainfalls came. S. hopes to mend it and is asking for a loan in order to replace the broken roof of her house.

loans.use: To replace the broken roof of her house

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe BENKADI 1  sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 41ans ont en moyenne 5  enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage et sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents.
MAH T. fait essentiellement la culture du riz, et compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et recruter de la main d'œuvre  pour entretenir : 2 hectares . 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000 FCFA  en fin de  campagne, qui   lui permettra de payer son prêt  et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace culturale encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The members of this BENKADI 1 group are married women whose average age is 41 and who have five children on average. They mostly live in polygamous families in COMOROW, one of the villages of the township of LOULOUNI in the Sous-prefecture of LOULOUNI, third administrative region of Mali. They joined Soro Yiriwaso so that they can undertake their agricultural activities during the rainy season and they are on their fourth loan with the institution, after having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans. MAH T. essentially cultivates rice and intends to use her share of the loan to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to hire laborers to help her farm 2 hectares. Her produce is sold in the village and the market of Loulouni after the harvest to a clientele composed of middlemen and also consumers. She expects to make a profit of 105,000 F CFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with everyday expenses. She hopes to continue to work together with Soro Yiriwaso so that she will be able to farm an even bigger acreage and make more profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: paying for labor, seed, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding, and minor agricultural equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of four children, she established a sweet shop in 2000. With her business income, she has been able to help her husband, who works as a van driver. They cooperate to pay school fees because their main objective is to allow their children to continue their education to university. She is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional sweets and a variety of candies to increase her sales and therefore her income. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003 (a Lebanese services company). In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free Kiva loans to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115.

loans.use: To purchase additional sweets and a variety of candies

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées   qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, ont en moyenne 3  enfants et   qui vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et  tous les prêts précédents se s ont  bien dénoués.
La spéculation  majoritairement cultivée est le riz  à l’image de SAMA VAMARA C. la présidente du groupe.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0.5 hectare. 
Le production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 20.000 FCFA en fin de campagne, qui  lui permettra de payer son prêt  et aussi  faire certaines dépenses familières.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKADI 2 group are married women who average 33 years of age and 3 children each. Most live in polygamous families in COMOROW, one of the villages of the LOULOUNI commune in LOULOUNI subprefecture, 3rd administratiave region of Mali. They collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. This is their fourth loan with the institution and all previous loans have been fully repaid. Just like SAMA VAMARA C., the group's leader, the predominant crop grown is rice. With her loan, she plans to buy planting supplies and small tools to maintain 0.5 hectare. The crops are sold in the village after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 20,000 CFA at the end of the crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and also to cover some family expenses. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to farm a larger area and make a greater profit.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planting supplies and small agricultural tools

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn S. is a 50-year-old, married woman and is blessed with six children. One of her children is now married and the other five are single. She currently stays at home to sell a few produce items in her small store in front of her home. Her husband owns a trailer-motor that he uses to operate a taxi service. 

Sorn S. has been planning to build a new house for her married child to live in, but her goal does not come true because of a lack of funds. To help achieve her goal, Sorn S. has decided to look a loan of $1,200 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, to add with her personal savings in order to construct a new house.

loans.use: To construct a new house

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, en moyenne 4  enfants et qui  vivent dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution et les  six prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués.
Le riz est la spéculation cultivée par TOTON C..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare . 
Après la récolte,la production est vendue à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000fcfa par campagne,qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’apporter sa contribution dans les dépenses familiales.
Elle souhaite continuer cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace culturale encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who average 37 years of age with an average of four children each; they live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their seventh loan from the institution and the six previous loans were all repaid correctly. The crop cultivated by Toton C. is rice. With her loan, she is planning to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment to maintain her half a hectare of land. Once the crop has been harvested, it is sold to a customer base made up of men and women in the village and at the market in Loulouni. She is planning to make an average profit of 30,000 FCFA during the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to make a contribution to the family expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to cultivate a larger area of land and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants and small farming materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing stonework projects. He is still quite young, but he has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with his construction work. He has been running his business for more than 10 years. Today he is requesting to borrow $1,200. He would like to expand his business by buying a small car for easier transport to the projects he works on. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Buying a small car

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Monsieur Adama M. est un jeune couturier qui exerce son métier dans le quartier de Diamaguene depuis prés de 8ans .Ainsi,pour diversifier ses activités le sieur M. sollicite un prêt pour complement achat d'un taxi clando dont il juge l'activité rentable pouvant générer des bénéfices ce qui lui permettrait de faire face à ses besoins quotidiens et à la survie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mr. Adama M. is a young tailor who has been practicing his trade in the Diamaguene district for almost eight years. In order to diversify his business activities, Mr. M. is seeking a loan towards the purchase of an unregistered taxi, which he sees as a profitable activity that will help him increase his revenues. This will allow him to provide for the everyday needs of himself and his family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be used towards the purchase of a taxi

loans.name: Elijah Tama

texts.en:
Elijah has been offering haircut and hairdressing services in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 38 years old, married to Esther Njeri and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He paid his previous loans of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) and Kshs 50,000 well and on time. He plans to use the proceeds from this new loan to re-stock his shop with cosmetics.  He will use some and sell some.

Elijah hopes to grow in this industry and open a training institute in hairdressing.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for his shop

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 4 est constitué   de 10  femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38ans ont en moyenne 4  enfants et qui  vivent majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et tous  les trois prêts précédents se sont  bien dénoués.
DIALIA LAMISSA D., qui est un des membre du groupe s’est spécialisée dans la culture du riz.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et recruter de la main d'œuvre  pour entretenir : 1hectare . 
 La récolte est vendue au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 60 000FCFA  en fin de campagne,qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 4 group is made up of ten married women who average 38 years of age and have an average of four children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth loan from the institution and the three previous loans were all repaid correctly. Dialia Lamissa D., who is one of the members of this group, specialises in growing rice. With her loan, she is planning to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment, as well recruiting workers to maintain her hectare of land. The harvested crop is sold at the market in Loulouni to a customer base made up of men and women. She is planning to make an average profit of 60,000 FCFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to help her husband out with the daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of labour, grains, fertilizer, weed killers, hoeing and small farming materials

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette S. est une jeune commerçante âgée de 30 ans et mére de famille qui exerce un commerce de vente de tissu de teinture, de chaussures et autres .En principe ses articles elle les achéte au Mali, en Gambie pour être revendu à des prix détaillés dans la ville de Mbour . Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités ce qui lui permet de générer des revenus et faire face à ses besoins personnels en soutenant ainsi son mari dans la gestion de la famille et de l'éducation des enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette S. is a young, 30 year-old retailer and a mother. She operates a business selling dyed fabric, shoes and other items. As a rule, she buys her goods in Mali and Gambia to be sold at retail prices in the city of Mbour. She is requesting this loan to expand her business. This will enable her to generate income and provide for her personal needs while helping her husband with the family's support and the children's education.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat R. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Marat and his wife operate a food-trading business out of a store in their town. He began his business in 2000 at a rented stall into the local market, where they sold consumer foods. 

His business is very important to his family because it's the only source of income. But thanks to his hard work and his wife's help and support, Marat was able to build a small shop and increase his working capital. Marat is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tukriks loan in order to purchase more supplements from Ulaanbaatar city at wholesales prices.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 5  est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées  ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 40ans, 5  enfants et  vivant dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et tous les trois prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz par DIALIA B..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et payer de la  main d’oeuvre pour entretenir : 1hectare . 
La production est vendue au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 55.000 FCFA  en fin de campagne, qui  lui permettra de payer son prêt et de contribuer pour certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
Benkadi 5 is a group of ten married women who average 40 years of age and have an average of five children each; they live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth loan from the institution and the three previous loans were all repaid correctly. The crop cultivated by Dialia B. is rice. With her loan, she is planning to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment, as well as recruiting workers to maintain her hectare of land. The harvested crop is sold at the market in Loulouni to a customer base made up of consumers and retailers. She is planning to make an average profit of 55,000 FCFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to make a contribution to certain daily expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to cultivate a larger area of land and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of labor, grains, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing and small farming materials

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe BENKADI 6  sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 39ans  en moyenne 4  enfants et qui vivent dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage et  sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Les  spéculations cultivées par le groupe  sont : le pois sucré et le riz. 
DJENEBA D. compte utiliser son prêt,pour  acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et payer les frais de main d’oeuvre pour entretenir : 1hectare . 
La production est vendue au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes après la récolte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA en fin de campagne, qui sera utilisé pour payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women who average 39 years of age and have an average of four children each; they live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth loan from the institution, having repaid the three previous loans correctly. The crops cultivated by the group are sugar peas and rice. Djeneba D. is planning to use her loan to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment, as well as recruiting workers to maintain her hectare of land. The harvested crop is sold to a customer base made up of men and women. She is planning to make an average profit of 60,000 FCFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to cultivate a larger area of land and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of labor, grains, weedkillers, hoeing and small farming materials

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S. is an old woman whose husband appears in the photo here. Un S. works as a cleaning staff member and spends time at home to take care of a young kid and do housework. She started her job in a small firm years ago and has earned a formal salary. Un S. has another financial earner in her husband who sells vegetable that he buys in bulk from the farmer. In the past, Un S.’s husband hired a vehicle to pick up his vegetables and take them to the market to sell. To reduce the fee of hiring a vehicle, Un S. is applying for a Kiva loan in order to buy a motor with trailer attached for her husband use to transport vegetables.

loans.use: To buy a motor with trailer attached.

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en: Altanzul B. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia in their own ger- a traditional nomadic housing tent. He began his food retailing business in 2003. In the future, Altanzul plans to expand his business and the amount and types of products he sells and increase the number of customers he attracts. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more supplements for his business and fix the stalls in where he sells the products.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and fix his stall

loans.name: Fatoumata Moussa's Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 7  sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38ans ont en moyenne 4  enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
FATOUMATA MOUSSA D., la présidente du groupe,  fait la culture du riz.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,5hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000FCFA en fin de  campagne, qui lui permettra de payer son prêt  et aussi d’aider la famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women who average 38 years of age and have an average of four children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth loan from the institution and the three previous loans were all repaid correctly. Fatoumata Moussa D., the president of the group, cultivates rice. With her loan, she is planning to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment to maintain her half a hectare of land. Once the crop has been harvested, it is sold to a customer base made up of men and women in the village and at the market in Loulouni. She is planning to make an average profit of 25,000 FCFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to help her family with the daily expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to cultivate a larger area of land and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants and small farming materials

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok H. is an older man whose wife appears in the photo above. Sok H. makes wooden furniture. He sells his finished product to buyers who come directly to his house and he hires a taxi to transport his furniture to sell around his community. He makes over 10 sets before selling out. He also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. His wife stays at home to do housework and also helps him in the business. The family always takes time to cultivate a rice crop during the farming season. Sok H. will use this loan to purchase a motorbike that has a cart attached. He will use the motorbike to pick up his product to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike that has an attached cart.

loans.name: Benkadi 8 Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six femmes toutes mariées, les membres du groupe BENKADI 8  ont  une moyenne d’âge de 35ans ont en moyenne 4  enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution et tous  les six prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués.
Les  spéculations cultivées sont : le manioc, le sésame et le riz avec MAKOURA C..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA en fin de  campagne, qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi de préparer le trousseau de mariage de sa fille aînée.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 8 group consists of six married women, on the average 35 years of age, with four children, who live mainly in polygamous families in Comorow, a village of the community of Loulouni in the Sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative district of Mali. They collaborate with the microfanice instiution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their agricultural enterprise during the winter season. They are now on their seventh loan, and all previous loans have been fully repaid. In the case of Makoura C., the grains cultivated are manioc, sesame and rice. With this loan, she plans to purchase agricultural inputs and small tools needed for working 1 hectare [about 2.5 acres] of land. After harvesting, the produce is sold locally at the market of Loulouni, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve a revenue of 50,000 West African Franks at the end of the season, which will allow her to repay her loan and also provide the bridal trousseau for her eldest daughter. She would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yirwaso in order to be able to work a larger field and obtain higher revenues.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs and small tools

loans.name: Berdimurat

texts.en: Berdimurat S. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia, in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. His three elder children attend a local middle school, and the youngest one stays at home. His wife helps him with his business. Berdimurat operates a machinery spare parts trading business and owns a small shop made of bricks nearby his home where he sells his products. He began his business in 2000 with a small wooden shop and after years of successful business operation, Berdimurat managed to enlarge the shop and expand his services. His spare parts trading business is quite seasonal, so he is thinking of running a business producing bricks in summertime. Therefore, he has rented a plot of land located not far from his town in order to start his brick manufacturing. Berdimurat hopes to expand his brick manufacturing within two years. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to get started producing bricks.

loans.use: To start a business producing bricks

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Mr. S. is an old man whose wife appears in the photo here. S. makes wooden furniture. He sells his finished product to buyers who come directly to his house and he transports his furniture to sell around his community. He is married to Chan Chreb, age 40, and they have three school-aged kids. To earn additional profit, S. is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make more products to sell.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Ganchimeg and her family have been living at the current address for five years. Her husband operates a taxi service in their town. She began her business in 2003 with her supportive mother and since that time, her business has grown steadily. Now Ganchimeg is planning to increase the types of products she sells and expand the amount of customers she attracts. Ganchimeg is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of food products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata N. est une employée de pharmacie comme vendeuse, elle est âgée de 46 ans et mariée pour arrondir sa mensualité elle exercie une activité de commerce de tissu provenant soit de la Mauritanie soit du Mali qu'elle place au niveau de sa clientéle et qu'elle récupère en mensualité ou hebdomadaire.Ainsi, madame N. sollicite ce prêt pour accroitre son fonds de commerce et sa rentabilité en générant du profit qui sera destiné à soutenir ses fréres et soeurs et s'occuper en même de l'éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata N. works as a salesperson for a pharmacy. She is 46 years old and married. To supplement her monthly salary, she operates a business selling fabric that comes from Mauritania or Mali. She sells the fabric that she collects weekly or monthly to her customers. Thus, Mrs. N. is requesting this loan to grow her working capital and her profitability by generating revenue. Her earnings will be used to support her brothers and sisters and to take care of her children’s education.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Née le 1er Janvier 1963 à N’Gola Kébila, dans la préfecture de Kolondiéba (région de Sikasso), Madame Aïssata M. est mariée, mère de neuf enfants et réside avec sa coépouse, leurs enfants et leur époux, commerçant, à Sanoubougou I-Koulikoro, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Aïssata M. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée depuis plus de six ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente de fruits (ananas, avocat, banane, banane plantain, orange, etc). Elle mène son activité au niveau des services de Douanes de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Elle a bénéficié de 2 prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement  remboursés. C'est ainsi qu’elle sollicite ce troisième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter  et de constituer un grand stock de fruits ( ananas, avocat, banane plantain, orange, etc.) en provenance de la Côte d’Ivoire qu’elle revend en détail et en gros à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce troisième prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 115 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on January 1, 1963 in N’Gola Kébila, in the Prefecture of Kolondiéba (the Sikasso region), Mrs. Aïssata M. is married and the mother of nine children. She lives with her husband (who is an entrepreneur), her husband’s second wife and their children in Sanoubougou I-Koulikoro, one of the peripheral districts of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Having tried various business activities without success, over six years ago Mrs. Aïssata M. started selling fruits (pineapples, avocados, bananas, plantains, oranges etc).
