She sells near the Customs’ office in Sikasso. In order to better satisfy the demands of her growing customer base, about three years ago she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She obtained two individual loans in the past and repaid them well. And thus she is seeking a third loan, which will allow her to buy a large supply of fruit (pineapples, avocados, plantains, oranges etc) from Côte d’Ivoire; she sells retail and wholesale to customers coming from all layers of society. With this third loan she plans to achieve a monthly income of 115,000 West African Francs, which will be used to bolster her business capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fruits

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar B. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. He graduated from 29th school, a special school for disabled and handicapped children. Hurelbaatar operates a business making wooden products and furniture in his town with the help of her wife.  The business is very family oriented, as Hurelbaatar designs and produces their products while his wife paints and decorates them. Hurelbaatar started his business in 2005. The business has been successful and they have grown a stable operation. Hurelbaatar and his wife work hard in order to build a new house in the area where the family currently lives. He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and paints.

loans.use: To purchase wood and paint

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man K. is an older woman and a widow. Man K. has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and she uses her knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family. Man K. also travels to sell her medicine by walking around her community. She now has three single kids and two who are married and live away from home. Man K. is concerned that she is hardly walking to sell and she dreams of having a vehicle to pick up her medicine, but she doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Man K. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Idriss

texts.en:
Idriss is married with three children, two of whom are school-going. He has a shop in the city center where he sells tailoring materials. He is assisted by his wife at the shop when he is out of town.

Idriss would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to increase his tailoring material stock. His materials are in very high demand and he would very much like to satisfy his customers.

Idriss plans to use the proceeds from this loan to complete the payment for a piece of land on which he has already made a part payment. He also hopes this loan will enable him to grow his business so that he can support his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing material to sell

loans.name: Famory

texts.fr:
Âgé de 28 ans, Monsieur Famory T. est célibataire résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  T. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès telle la vente de carburants, s’est initié au domaine du commerce d’articles divers pour son Alimentation (Eau minérale, boissons, Déodorants, et cartes de recharge de téléphone Malitel/Orange, etc.) il  y a environ quatre ans. Il mène cette activité à Wayerma I et est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux années et est à son troisième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été tous correctement remboursés.
 Ce troisième lui permettra d’acheter 30 cartons de l’Eau minérale, 20 paquets de boissons NBB, 2 cartons de biscuits, 7 cartons de Déodorants, 500 cartes de recharge Malitel/Orange, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes sur place et des représentants des deux réseaux de télécommunication avant de les revendre en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de toutes couches sociales de la ville.
Avec ce troisième prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Famory T. is a single 28 year old who lives in a large extended family in Wayerma I, a sought after neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (in the Third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). After trying a number of unsuccessful ventures such as selling fuel, Mr. T. started a grocery store (including mineral water, drinks, deodorants, and phone cards) about four years ago. He runs this business in Wayerma I and is very popular with his clients because of the quality of his products. In order to satisfy the demands of his ever increasing clientele, he joined the microfinance partner Soro Yiriwaso over two years ago, and is now on his third individual loan. The previous loans were all repaid on time. This third loan will allow him to buy 30 cases of mineral water, 20 packages of NBB drinks, 2 cases of biscuits, 7 cases of deodorant, 500 Malitel/Orange phone cards, etc. The merchandise is bought from wholesalers and from distributors for the two telecommunications networks; he then sells at wholesale or retail prices to clients from all walks of life. With this third loan, he hopes to make a profit of 200,000 francs per month, which will be used to contribute to family expenses, pay interest on the loan, and reinvest into his business.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted products for his grocery store

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Agée de 37 ans, Madame Kadia D. est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Mamassoni, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadia D. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée il y a environ deux  ans à la vente des habits de friperie en provenance de la république du Ghana. Elle vend ses friperies de façon ambulante dans les quartiers de la ville où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois ans. Après 2 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) avec une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce quatrième prêt lui permettra de se rendre elle-même au Ghana pour acheter des balles de friperies de qualités différentes (T-shirt, Chemises, porte clés, poupées, etc.) afin de les revendre avec ses enfants de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes de sa localité.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 135 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia D. is 37 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband and children in Mamassoni, a neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (Third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). After trying a number of unsuccessful ventures, Mrs. D. started selling second hand clothing from Ghana about two years ago. She sells the clothing door to door in other neighborhoods in the city, where she is highly sought after by her clients because of the quality of her goods. She joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance partner over three years ago. After 2 group loans with a neighborhood women's association, she is now on her 4th individual loan, and all her previous loans have been repaid. This fourth loan will allow her to go to Ghana herself to buy bales of used clothing of various types (T-shirts, shirts, key rings, dolls, etc.) so she and her children can re-sell them door to door to a clientele that is usually neighborhood women. With this loan, she hopes to earn income of 135,000 francs per month which she will use to increase her working capital, contribute to the family's expenses, and pay interest on the loan.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing..

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya D.  est âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il réside avec sa famille dans sa propre maison à Banconi, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Après une formation de thérapeute, il s’est vite initié aux activités pharmaceutiques depuis plus de vingt ans. Avec une telle longue expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. 
Ainsi, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il a déjà bénéficié 2 prêts individuels, tous correctement remboursés. 
Dans le cadre de toujours mieux améliorer son activité, il sollicite un  troisième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter 10 cartons de Manames, 9 bidons d’inzam indien, 3 cartons d’Aloé. 
Il s’approvisionnera à Lomé (république de Togo); auparavant (avant son adhésion à Soro Yiriwaso) il s’approvisionnait auprès de son fournisseur à Koutiala pour venir les revendre à Sikasso dans sa pharmacopée située à la gare routière de Sikasso à une clientèle composée des voyageurs et surtout de routiers. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya D. is 40 years old, married and father to two children. He lives with his family in his own house in Banconi, one of the outer suburbs of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having trained as a therapist, he launched himself rapidly into the pharmaceutical business more than twenty years ago. With such a long experience in this domain, he enjoys a good reputation and gets a lot of orders; his resources are however insufficient to satisfy these needs. He thus decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, from which he has already had two individual loans, both of which were repaid correctly. With a view to constantly improving his business, he is requesting a third loan which will allow him to buy ten cartons of "manames", nine containers of Indian "inzam" and three cartons of Aloe (natural medecines). He gets his supplies in Lomé (in the Republic of Togo); previously (before he joined Soro Yiriwaso) he stocked up from his supplier in Koutiala in order to resell in his pharmacy in Sikasso's bus station to a customer base made up of travelers, and above all lorry drivers. Some of his customers pay cash and others buy on credit. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 300,000FCFA. With the profits he makes he hopes to be able to cover the bulk of his expenses and those of his family, as well as paying the interest on his loan; the rest will be invested in his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicines

loans.name: Yayah Y.

texts.en:
Yayah is married with one dependent. He has a diploma in Business Studies and has spent five years in business. He has a shop trading in men's clothing (T-shirts and jeans) and is very hardworking.

Yayah is applying for a loan of Le 3,000,000 with which he would like to buy more stock from Conakry, the capital of Guinea. He hopes this loan will allow him to pursue his studies at the university level and to also build a home for his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for his shop

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim K. is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been operating a beauty business since the beginning of this year. In the local market, she owns a kiosk where she sells different kinds of miscellaneous materials. She sells items such as perfumes, beauty products, and some fake jewelry to people who come to buy anything in the market. Khim K. is married to 30-year-old, Choun Chenda, who is a professional teacher. The couple is blessed with a young kid who is still not enrolled in school. In order to earn extra profit and to make the business more successful, Khim K. will be using the loan she requested to accumulate a larger quantity of her inventory items.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of inventory items

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, Madame Bintou C. est âgée de 44 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Bintou n’a pas eu la chance de continuer  ses études primaires, c’est ainsi qu’elle s’intéressa tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus, depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour la vente des fruits et légumes il y a 10 ans. Apprise auprès de sa maman, cette activité lui procure bien de revenus et marche très bien, puisque les fruits et légumes sont des desserts qu’on a tous besoin pour notre bien être.  Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  en qualité et  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son sixième  prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été payer sans difficulté. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 3 paniers de bananes,  5 paniers de pomme de terre, 7 paniers d’oranges et autres. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Koutiala et Sikasso et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes,  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 5 children, Mrs. Bintou C. is 44 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her spouse and her children in the Sogomougou neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (region of Sikasso). For social reasons, Bintou did not have the chance to continue her primary schooling, which is why she interested herself in revenue-generating businesses from an early age. After having run several businesses without success, she finally opted to sell fruits and vegetables 10 years ago. Learned from her mother, this business makes her good revenues and runs very well, since fruits and vegetables are desserts that we need for our well-being. To satisfy her customers' needs of quality and quantity, and to increase the size of her business, she decided to appeal to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 5 solidarity loans (group loans) all paid back in full, she is on her sixth individual loan, all of which were paid back without difficulty. With this loan, she expects to buy 3 baskets of bananas, 5 baskets of potatoes, 7 baskets of oranges and other things. She gets her supplies in the different weekly fairs in the villages surrounding Koutiala and Sikasso and makes her sales at the big market in Koutiala to a customer base composed of men and women, for cash and credit. She expects to make an average profit of 70,000 FCFA per month, which she plans to use to pay back her interest, to contribute to the daily expenditures of her family, and to invest the remainder in other revenue-generating businesses.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Haoua

texts.fr:
Madame Haoua Touré  a 41 ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari sa coépouse  et leurs  enfants dans le quartier Lafiala de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Madame Haoua n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier dû è des problèmes de famille, elle n’a donc pas pris du temps pour embraser les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman depuis son jeune âge.
Elle mène plusieurs activités génératrices  de revenus qui lui procurent assez de revenus telles la vente de tissus, de bazins teintés. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Haoua a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 2005.  Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous remboursés correctement, elle est à son quatrième prêt  individuel dont les prêts antérieurs ont été payer sans difficulté.   
Madame Haoua compte utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat  des stocks de tissus et divers autres petits objets  à Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente dans les différents quartiers de Koutiala  et Sikasso à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec l’augmentation de son fonds de commerce, Haoua compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel  de 90 000 FCFA  qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haoua Touré is 41 years old and the mother of 5 children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse and their children in the Lafiala neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (region of Sikasso). Mrs. Haoua did not have the opportunity to go to school due to family problems, so she did not take long to take up income-making activities, along with her mother, at a young age. She runs several income-making businesses, which earn her a decent income, such as the sale of fabrics and dyed damask. To keep her customers satisfied, Haoua appealed to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in 2005. After 6 solidarity loans (group loans), all paid back in full, she is on her fourth individual loan, having paid back all her previous loans without difficulty. Mrs. Haoua expects to use her loan to purchase stocks of fabrics and various other small objects in Koutiala. She makes her sales in different neighborhoods of Koutiala and Sikasso to a client base of women and men, for cash and for credit. With the growth of her store's funds, Haoua expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA that she will use to pay back the interest, to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions and to invest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dyed damask

loans.name: Sindiya (Consanguinité) Group

texts.fr:
Sindiya est un regroupement de femme du premier quartier de Koutiala (région de Sikasso) qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le charbon de bois, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements,  les céréales, les légumes etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Awa C. qui est un membre du groupe Sindiya, fait du commerce d’articles divers tels le charbon de bois, les condiments alimentaires, le bois de chauffe, les légumes, etc.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt actuel pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en charbon de bois et en bois de chauffe et des  fruits et légumes (concombre, gombo, papaye, ignames, etc). 
Elle se procure  de ces marchandises auprès des  paysans producteurs dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires tels Zangasso, Koro barrage et Dogonasso. Elle vend le charbon  de bois en détail et au comptant  à une clientèle diverse et variée, quant aux légumes, ils sont vendus en gros au fur et à mesure à une clientèle composée de revendeuses. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Sindiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Awa C. compte réaliser 160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Sindiya is a group of women from the first neighborhood of Koutiala (region of Sikasso) who know each other well and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 35 years old, married and the mothers of at least 4 children each. This group of women runs businesses selling various goods such as charcoal, firewood, clothing grains, vegetables, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago. They are on their third group loan, having fully paid back all of their previous ones. Awa C., who is a member of the group Sindiya, runs a business selling various goods such as charcoal, condiments, firewood, vegetables. etc. She expects to use her loan to buy cartloads of charcoal and firewood and fruits and vegetables (cucumber, okra, papaya, yams, etc). She gets her merchandise from peasant farmers in the different weekly markets, such as Zangasso, Koro barrage and Dogonasso. She sells charcoal for retail and for cash to a varied and diverse customer base; as for the vegetables, they are sold wholesale as one goes along to a client base made up of resellers. While the members of the group Sindiya expect to make an average profit of 120,000 FCFA each during the course of the loan, Awa C. expects to make 160,000 FCFA. Besides paying back the loans, they will use a part of their income to deal with their families' current expenditures.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various goods

loans.name: Balimaya (La Parenté) Group

texts.fr:
Balimaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont  toutes mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, la vente des produits de première nécessité, la restauration, les fruits et légumes, les habillements,  les céréales etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Mariam Sangaré est un membre du groupe Balimaya qui est boutiquière d’achat vente d’articles divers.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter diverses marchandises (sucre, thé  bonbons, biscuits, pâtes alimentaires, savons, huile, du lait en poudre etc. 
Elle achète ses marchandises au grand marché de Koutiala avec les grossistes. Elle vend ses produits en détail et au comptant dans une boutique bien aménagée, à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Balimaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mariam Sangaré compte réaliser 150 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elle souhaite voir renforcé ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour qu’il n’y ait plus de ruptures de stocks.
texts.en:
Balimaya is a group of women from the Darsalam neighborhood of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 35 years old, all married and the mothers of at least 3 children each. This group of women runs businesses selling various goods such as the sale of products meeting basic needs, catering, fruits and vegetables, clothing, grains, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program 3 years ago. They are on their fifth group loan, having paid back all of their previous loans in full. Mariam Sangaré is a member of the group Balimaya, who runs a boutique buying and selling various goods. She expects to use her loan to buy various merchandise (sugar, tea, candy, cookies, pasta, soaps, oil, powdered milk, etc). She buys her merchandise at the big market in Koutiala with wholesalers. She buys products for retail and for cash in a well-equipped boutique, to a diverse and varied client base. While the members of the group Balimaya expect to make an average profit of 120,000 FCFA each during the course of the loan, Mariam Sangaré expects to make 150,000 FCFA. Besides paying back the loans, they will use a part of their income to deal with their families' current expenditures. They wish to see their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso reinforced so that they will have no further breaks in their supplies.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of various products

loans.name: Akouavi Angèle

texts.fr: A. Akouavi Angèle est née le 04 mai 1974 à Adjaha dans le Mono au Bénin. Mariée à EDAH Gérard un chauffeur Angèle est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Angèle a fréquenté l'école et n'a fait que les cours primaires. Angèle vit depuis quatre ans dans le quartier Bazounkpa à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Benin. Angèle vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les charges de la famille. Pour y parvenir et subvenir à ses besoins, Angèle mène comme activité, la fabrication et la vente de matelas et parallèlement la vente d'oreillers. Angèle s'approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin et vend à PK3 AKPAKPA (Cotonou). Angèle avait déjà bénéficié d'un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé avec un bon remboursement. C'est dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse que Angèle sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akouavi Angèle A. has been born on May 4, 1974 in Adjaha in Mono Department of Benin. Married to Gérard Edah, a driver, she is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. Angèle attended school but finished only the primary level of studies. Angèle has been living in the Bazounkpa district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for four years. Angèle helps her husband and shares the responsibility for family budget with him. In order to provide for her family needs, she manufacturers and sells mattresses, in addition, she also sells pillows. She stocks up in the North of Benin and sells in PK3 Akaka (Cotonou). She already had an loan from ALIDé in the past and repaid it well. In order to strengthen her business and respond to the growing customer demand Angèle is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 4 cotton bales for manufacturing mattresses and pillows

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is married with two children. His wife is very active in the area and introduced him to the owner of the premise where his workshop is currently located.

Albert is a welder; he has six years experience in metalwork. At his welding shop, he is actively involved in the production of metal doors, windows, gates and various metal tools and items used in homes for sale. He currently has eight young trainees at his workshop as well.

Albert has a very good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more production materials such as metal sheets, iron rods and metal bars so that he can produce more items. 

Albert intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate his children and begin to construction a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more metal sheets, iron rods, iron bars and other welding materials

loans.name: Assiba Félicité

texts.fr: A. Assiba Félicité est née le 21 octobre 1976 à Covè au Bénin. Mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, Félicité est mariée à DJOSSA Mathieu un électricien bâtiment. Félicié vit avec son mari et ses enfants depuis près de six ans à Womey un quartier dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Félicité a fréquenté l'école et a fait les cours secondaires. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Félicité exerce comme activité principale la vente de fruits, d'arachide, de biscuits et bombons et quelques boites de conserves. Félicité s'approvisionne au grand marché international du Bénin Dantokpa et revend ses produits à domicile. Félicité avait déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'agrandir son commerce et satisfaire sa clientèle Félicité sollicite un nouveau prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Assiba Félicité A. was born on October 21, 1976 in Covè, Benin. The mother of three children attending school, Félicité is married to Mathieu Djossa, a building electrician. She has lived with her husband and children in the Womey neighborhood of Abomey Calavi for about six years. Félicité went to school and completed secondary courses, and the couple pays the family’s expenses together. Félicité’s primary business is the sale of fruits, peanuts, cookies and candies, and some canned goods. She buys her stock in Benin’s large international market, Dantokpa, and resells her products at home. She has already obtained three loans through ALIDé, all of which have been repaid in full. With the goal of growing her business and satisfying her customers, Félicité is requesting a new loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 3 bags of oranges, 10 boxes of biscuits, and 5 cartons of milk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her two parents. After getting 10 years of experience working as a tailor, she opened a small tailoring shop in 2005 near to her house. She makes different clothing designs at the request of her clientele. She also repairs used clothes. With her income, she supports her father in the household. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase tailoring supplies and more textiles to versify her products. In the future, she would like to expand her client base and she hopes to open a small tailoring factory. 
 
Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been withheld to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen: 

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in Lebanese Microfinance since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement to their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase tailoring supplies and more textiles

loans.name: Alejandrina Pilar

texts.es:
Alejandrina Pilar A. A., tiene 47 años.  Es soltera y vive sola,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijo.

Alejandrina es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Alejandrina se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz, fréjol y papas. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra semillas de  arroz, maíz, fréjol y papas. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños tener una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Alejandrina Pilar A. A. is 47 years old. She is single and she lives alone in the city of Ventanas in the Los Rios province. She has no children. Alejandrina is a member of the rural village of Valle Alto, located in the Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in the group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan requested from the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Alejandrina is an agriculturist and she plants rice, corn, beans and potatoes. She makes her purchases every month in the cities of Ventanas and Fertiza and in the shopping district of Pena. She also makes her sales there. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, corn, beans and potato seeds. She sees this loan as an opportunity for success. Her dreams are to have her own home. Her greatest challenges are having to deal with plagues in her plantations. She enjoys her work.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, corn, bean and potato seeds.

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
Carmen Pilar B. A., tiene 23 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres y hermanos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijo.

Carmen es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Carmen se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y maíz en ciclo cortó. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz y maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es prosperar en el trabajo. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Carmen Pilar B. A. is 23 years old. She is single, and she lives with her parents and her siblings. She lives in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. She does not have children. Carmen is a member of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) Communal Bank. It is located in the Voluntad de Dios precint, which is an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in all, and most of them devote themselves to agriculture. This is their second loan with the Cooperativa San José. Carmen is a farmer, and she grows rice and corn in a short cycle. She makes her purchases every month at Fertiza in the city of Ventanas and at the Peña market, and she sells her products at the same place She is requesting the loan to buy rice and corn seeds. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity go get ahead. Her dream is to prosper in her work. She faces challenges like pest infestation. She likes to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and corn seeds

loans.name: Maryuri Mariuxi

texts.es:
Maryuri Mariuxi B. C., tiene 20 años.  Es soltera y vive con el hijo, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Josué.

Maryuri es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Maryuri se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es comprar una casa y poner un negocio en Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta escuchar la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Maryuri Mariuxi B. C. is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her son in Ventanas, which is in the Los Ríos province. She has one son, Josué. Maryuri is a member of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) solidarity group, which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, one and one-half hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members altogether, mainly farmers. This is the second loan they have taken out from Cooperativa San José. Maryuri is a farmer who grows rice, corn and beans. She makes her purchases each month in the city of Ventanas in Fertiza and at the Peña market, and she sells her products at the same place. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying seeds for rice, corn and beans. She thinks the loan is a chance for her to get ahead. Her dreams are to buy a house and set up a business in Ventanas. She faces challenges like pests. She likes to listen to the Word of God.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds for rice, corn and beans

loans.name: Edy Patricio

texts.es:
Edy Patricio Z. V., tiene 35 años.  Estado unión libre y vive con el hijo, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Wendy (3) y Elkin (11 meses).

Edy es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Edy se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y tomate. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y tomate. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es comprar una casa y buscar el mejor estudio para los hijos. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edy Patricio Z. V. is 35 years old. He has a common-law marriage and lives with his children in Ventanas, which is in Los Ríos province. He has 2 children, Wendy (3) and Elkin (11 months). Edy is a member of the “Valle Alto” (High Valley) solidarity group, which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, one and one-half hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members altogether, most of them farmers. This is the second loan they have taken out with Cooperativa San José. Edy is a farmer who grows rice, corn and tomatoes. He makes his purchases every month in the city of Ventanas, at Fertisa [an agricultural supply vendor] and at the Peña market, and he sells his products at the same place. He is asking for the loan to invest in buying seeds for rice, corn and tomatoes. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to buy a house and to look for the best education for his children. He faces challenges like pests. He likes to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, corn and tomato seeds

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Q. M. tiene 58 anos. Es casado y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene siembras de maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas.

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Esta préstamo lo ayudaria en mejorar la situación economica de gastos de insumos para la agricultura. Espera seguir adelante y tener una casa propia. Un desafio que se enfrenta a la familia es que fallecio dos de sus hijos. 

No tiene mucho tiempo libre. Enfoca en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos Q. M. is 58 years old. He is married and lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. He has 3 children. Carlos is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús solidarity group. There are 15 members altogether, who are mainly farmers. Carlos is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He makes purchases and product sales in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan for his farming. This loan would help him improve his economic situation for buying farm supplies. He hopes to get ahead and have his own house. A challenge the family faces is that two of his children passed away. Carlos does not have much free time. He focuses on his work.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina D. is currently in the business of selling bread, cooking oil and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Regina is 35 years old and is married to a builder. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel C. Q. tiene 40 anos. Es viudo y vive con sus hijos en el canton de Ventanas en la província de Los Rios. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Jose es socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para avanzar en su agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejorara su situación economico. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel C. Quilla is 40 years old. He is a widower, and he lives with his children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. He has five children. Jose is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all. Most of them are farmers. Jose is a farmer, and he grows corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sells his products in the Ventanas canton. He is requesting a loan in order to make agricultural progress. With the support of the loan his financial situation will improve. In his free time he likes to play with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make progress with his farming

loans.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es:
Oscar Ernesto C. M. tiene 19 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. 

Oscar es un socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, cacao, y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejora la situación económico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio para seguir adelante. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Le gusta practicar el deporte de futbol y boli.
texts.en:
Oscar Ernesto C. M. is 19 years old. He is single, and he lives with his parents. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. Oscar is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Oscar is a farmer, and he grows corn, cacao, and rice. He makes his purchases and sells his products in the Ventanas canton. He is requesting a loan for farming. With the support of this loan his financial situation will improve. He dreams of buying his own piece of land in order to get ahead. A challenge that he has faced in his work is that his corn has diseases and insect infestations. One of these is specifically called “longosta” (locust). He likes to play soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther P. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Esther is 31 years old and is married to a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es:
Luis Bernardo M. M. tiene 23 anos. Vive en union libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene un hijo que se llama Leonel. 

Luis es socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra del maíz y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para sembrar maíz. El préstamo lo ayudaria en comprar los insumos para su agricultura. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio y tener un solar para su familia. 

Le gusta hacer el deporte de futbol indor.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old and lives with his partner in the village of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. He has a son named Leonel. Luis is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús community bank. There are 15 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture, like Luis, who harvests corn and cocoa. He buys and sells his products in Ventanas. He is requesting the loan to plant corn. The loan will help him purchase supplies for his crops. His dream is to purchase his own land and have a home for his family. He enjoys playing indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant corn

loans.name: Livingston Javier

texts.es:
Livingston Javier A. R., tiene 21 años.  Es soltero  y vive con los padres, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijos.

Livingston es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Livingston se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es comprar una casa y salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.

Le gusta jugar indor y dolí.
texts.en:
Livingston is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents in the village of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. He does not have any children. Livingston is a member of the Valle Alto community bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and half from Ventanas. There are 23 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture. This is the second loan they have taken out with Kiva partner Cooperativa San José. Livingston makes a living planting rice, corn and beans. He makes his purchases every month in the towns of Ventanas and Peña and makes his sales in the same places. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, corn and beans. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to make headway. His dreams are to buy a house and pursue his studies. His crops face challenges like pests. Livingston enjoys playing indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for rice, corn and beans

loans.name: Ida Kalé

texts.fr: Née le 13 avril 1969 au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, A. Ida Kalé est mariée à AZINFAN Réné un soudeur. Ida est Mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Ida vit depuis sept ans avec son mari et son enfant à Womey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Ida vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les charges de la famille. Pour y parvenir, Ida prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs fermenté avec de la sauce au tomate fraiche) à la devanture de son domicile. Ida achète ses produits dans le petit marché de son quartier et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ida a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé avec un bon remboursement. Dans le but de satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle et d'agrandir son commerce, Ida demande un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on April 13, 1969 in Togo, a country neighboring Benin, Ms. A. Ida Kalé is married to Mr. AZINFAN Réné, a welder. She is the mother of one child, who has attended school. Ida has been living with her husband and child for seven years in Womey, in the community of Abomey Calavi. She helps out her husband and, along with him, supports the family. To do so, she makes and sells food (a kind of fermented polenta served with fresh tomato sauce) in front of her home. She gets her supplies at the small market in her district and at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Ida has already benefited from three loans from ALIDé and has repaid them. With the goal of satisfying the requirements of her customers and to expand her business, she is asking for a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 5 sacks of corn and 3 baskets of condiments

loans.name: Angela Lastenia

texts.es:
Angela Lastenia B. A., tiene 27 años.  Es soltero  y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, Jhair (8), Damian (6), Rodrigo (4) y Tatiana (1).

Angela es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Angela se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y maíz en ciclo cortó. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz y maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.
Le gusta jugar fútbol.
texts.en:
Angela is 27 years old, single and lives with her children in the village of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. She has four children: Jhair (8), Damian (6), Rodrigo (4) and Tatiana (1). Angela is a member of the "Valle Alto" (High Valley) community bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture. This is the second loan they have taken out with Kiva partner Cooperativa San José. Angela make a living in agriculture, planting rice and corn in short cycles. She makes her purchases every month in the towns of Ventanas and Peña and makes her sales in the same places. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice and corn. She thinks the loan is an opportunity to make headway. Her dreams are to move forward with her studies. Her crops face challenges like pests. She enjoys playing soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for rice and corn

loans.name: Hannah Mugure

texts.en:
Hannah has been in stone extraction since 2003.  She is 31 years old and a single mother of six school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to add more casual workers in her quarry to help in extraction.

Hannah hopes to buy several pieces of land for extraction of stone in the future.

loans.use: To add more casual workers to work on her site.

loans.name: Rose Mukuhi

texts.en:
Rose is 31 years old, married to Wathumba Chege, and they have three children.  She ventured into quarrying and stone extraction two years ago, which  has proven to be successful, and she now wants to buy another piece of land to be able to extract more stones.

She hopes to be extracting stones in large quantities in the future and to be a major supplier.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice has been involved in tailoring and dressmaking for five years now.  She is 26 years old, married to Joseph Maina, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy more fabric from which she will make more dresses to sell and meet the demands of her customers.

Eunice hopes to continue in dressmaking and become a big market player in both tailoring and dressmaking in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for sewing

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina S. C., es Madre soltera y trabaja para mantener a su familia, tiene tres hijos ya que su pareja la abandono cuando ella estaba con su hijo apenas nacido y desde entonces ella se hace cargo de su familia.

Paulina S. C. es un señora muy trabajadora, se dedica al cultivo de arroz y naranja, es madre de tres hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, ella al igual que su hijo mayor se levantan muy temprano a trabajar en su chaco para  que sus plantaciones sean buenas y así poder venderlas al mercado local más cercano y todos los días tiene la misma rutina. 
 
La señora Paulina S. C. se apersono a las oficinas por un comentario de uno de sus vecinos el cual le comento que en CIDRE daban créditos para la producción y que el actualmente saco un crédito y que mejoro su producción gracias al CIDRE, la señora paulina vino en busca de un crédito para comprar plantines y así mejorar un poco su producción;  para poder llevar una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Paulina S. C. is a single mother who works to support her family. She has three children, and was abandoned by her husband when her child had just been born. Since that time, she has been responsible for her family. Paulina S. C. is a hard-working woman. She grows rice and oranges, and is the mother of three children, whom she helps and supports in their education. Along with her oldest child, she rises early to work on her farm, so that her crops will be good and she can sell them at the closest local market. She follows the same routine every day. Paulina S. C. came to the office because of a comment made by one of her neighbors, who said that CIDRE would give loans for production, and that he had taken out a loan and improved his production, thanks to CIDRE. Paulina came to ask for a loan to buy seedlings and thus improve her production a little, in order to have a better life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for orange harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Motorcycle repair

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El Señor Ronald Sánchez Mejía es una persona que desde muy joven se fue de su hogar, en busca de trabajo, el llego a Ivirgarzama donde contó con la ayuda de su hermana mayor, es soltero y no tiene hijos.

Actualmente el trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis “2 de Agosto” es muy responsable en la labor que desempeña, se levanta a muy tempranas horas por la mañana para brindar sus servicios con el apoyo de su sindicato ya que ellos les otorgan turnos en las diferentes paradas que actualmente cuenta el sindicato.

El señor Ronald Sánchez Mejía se apersono a CIDRE por el comentario de sus compañeros del sindicato  para poder saber algo de créditos y si es que podía solicitar uno para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta) para así poder facilitar la vida que lleva, y así poder tener más ingresos para su bienestar propio y así en un fututo poder formar una familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ronald Sánchez Mejía Leith left his home in search of work when he was very young. He arrived in Ivirgarzama, where he got help from his older sister. He is single and has no children. He currently works with the “2 de Agosto” moto taxi union, and is very responsible about his work. He rises at very early hours every morning to provide his services, and receives help from the union. The union assigns turns to the different stops that it controls. Mr. Ronald Sánchez Mejía came to CIDRE, after hearing from his coworkers, to learn about loans and to see if he could request one to buy a vehicle (motorcycle) that would help simplify his life. This would allow him to earn a greater income for his own well being, which would allow him to start a family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle

loans.name: Zinunula Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
Ten years ago, it was savings from his farming and brick making businesses that facilitated and spawned the establishment of his current commercial motorcycle business in Bujjuko-Mpigi. This is all taken into perspective by 35-year-old Baliza J., as he makes unprecedented progress in his business. 

This cheerful and sturdy father of five says he has been able to live within his means with an income of $14 a week.  While the idea of getting back into full scale farming is alluring, he says he is comfortable doing it on a small scale just now. 

He considers himself somebody who likes to create a relaxed and pleasant atmosphere around other people. He says that attribute has been his strength in attracting customers. 

With this loan, he is looking at diversifying into poultry. He says with this money he is going to buy chickens to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of chickens for reselling

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira Q. M. tiene 43 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Jacinto y Jefre. 

Rosa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene siembras de maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para comprar los insumos, abonos, y semillas de agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejoraria la situación economico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Le gusta pasar tiempo en la casa en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira Q. M. is 43 years old. She is married and lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 2 children named Jacinto y Jefre. Rosa is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús solidarity group. There are 15 members altogether, mostly farmers. Rosa is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She makes her purchases and product sales in Ventanas Canton. She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers and seeds, so that with the help of this loan she will improve her economic situation. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. One challenge that she has faced in her work is diseases in her corn and pests, and one pest in particular called ¨longosta.¨ In her free time, she likes to spend time at home.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: agriculture

loans.name: Edison Enrique

texts.es:
Edison Enrique C. R., tiene 24 años.  Es soltero  y vive con la mama, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Edison.

Edison es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Edison se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Edison Enrique C. R. is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in the Ventanas province of Los Rios. He has one son, Edison. Edison is a member of the community bank "Valle Alto," which is located in Voluntad de Dios precinct, an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. This is their second loan with the San José Cooperative. Edison works in agriculture. He plants rice, corn, and beans. He makes his purchases every month in the city of Ventanas and sells his products in the Peña commercial center or in the same location. He is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, corn, and beans. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to advance himself. His dreams are to go further in his studies. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases. He likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds for rice, corn, and beans

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz P. G. tiene 33 anos. Vive soltera en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 3 hijos de 16, 9, y 6 anos.  

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y a trabajo laboral con su vecino. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Ventanas. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en labores agrícolas como maiz. El apoyo del préstamo cambiaria mucho su vida. Lo permitirá comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que se pone en el cultivo de maíz. Su sueno es tener una casa propia y darles a sus hijos una buena educación. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Le gusta ver las noticias en la noche.
texts.en:
Maria Luz P. G. is 33 years old, single, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has three children (ages 16, 9, and 6).

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesús”. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Maria is a farmer who grows corn and also performs work for her neighbor. She buys and sells her products in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her farming activities, such as growing corn. The support provided through this loan will bring great change to her life. It will allow her to buy the supplies and fertilizers she needs to grow corn. Her dream is to have her own home and provide her children with a good education. The challenges she faces in her work include the diseases and pests that impact her corn. One of these pests is known as “langosta”.

At night, Maria enjoys watching the news.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & fertilizers for growing corn

loans.name: Dora Clemencia

texts.es:
Dora Clemencia R. C., tiene 24 años.  Es soltero  y vive con la mama, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Edison.

Dora es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Dora se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños seguir adelante con la bendición de Dios y el apoyo de la cooperativa San Jose. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dora Clemencia R. C. is 24 years old, single, and lives with her mother in Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ríos. She has a son named Edison.

Dora is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Alto” (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture. This the second loan they have received from Cooperativa San José.

Dora is a farmer who grows rice, corn, and beans. She buys her supplies each month in the city of Ventanas and sells her products at the Peña commercial market which is in the same area.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams include moving forward with God’s blessing and the support of Cooperativa San José. The challenges she faces include the pests and diseases that can impact her crops.

Dora enjoys working so that she can succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans

loans.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es:
Maria Narcisa C. A., tiene 31 años.  Es soltero  y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, Julia (13), Jose (11), Anahi (4) y Johan (7).

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños salir adelante. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Maria Narcisa C. A. is 31 years old, single, and lives with her four children in Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ríos. Her children’s names are Julia (age 13), José (age 11), Anahi (age 4), and Johan (age 7).

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Alto” (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture. This is the second loan they have received from Cooperativa San José.

Maria is a farmer who grows rice, corn, and beans. She buys her supplies each month in the city of Ventanas and sells her products at the Peña commercial market which is also in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to succeed. The challenges she faces include the pests and diseases that can impact her crops.

Maria enjoys working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans

loans.name: Elsa Mariana

texts.es:
Elsa Mariana S. M. tiene 20 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la província de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos, una de 4 anos y otra de 3 meses. 

Elsa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Elsa se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz, maíz, yuca, y platano. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita esta préstamo para avanzar en su agricultura. Con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejoraria la situación economico de gastos de insumos. Su sueno es seguir adelante y progresar. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Con su tiempo, trabaja y hace cosas en la casa, y a veces se va de paseo.
texts.en:
Elsa Mariana S. M. is 20 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has two children, ages 4 and 3 months.

Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesús”. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Elsa is a farmer who grows rice, corn, cassava, and bananas. She buys and sells her products in the canton of Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan so that she can make progress in her farming activities. With the support provided through this loan, she will be able to improve her financial situation and pay for supplies and expenses. Her dream is to become successful and continue advancing. One challenge that she faces in her work is fighting pests that can ruin her corn. One of these pests is known as “langosta”.

Elsa spends her time working and making things at home, but sometimes she enjoys going for a walk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her farming activities

loans.name: Romulo Alvaro

texts.es:
El Romulo Alvaro V. P. es un Joven Soltero que vive en la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona conocida como Las Cuadras. Romulo apenas terminada su carrera de Medicina ya es parte del Ministerio de Salud y Deportes trabajando como Residente Medico en la Comunidad Aguirre II a unos cuantos kilómetros de Sacaba. Romulo trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud y Deporte hace más o menos 4 años. El mercado es sumamente amplio puesto que la falta de médicos en las diferentes provincias de nuestro país es un problema bastante grande y es gracias a personas como Romulo que la gente pobre de las zonas más alejadas de Bolivia pueden tener Atención Medica.

Romulo requiere el crédito para poder comprar Instrumentos Médicos para poder brindar un mejor servicio a la gente de la comunidad donde trabaja y de esa manera ser un  mejor medico. Su mayor sueño es poder algún día tener dinero suficiente para poder abrir una clínica y ayudar a la gente de bajos recursos.
texts.en:
Romulo Alvaro V. P. is a young single man who lives in Cochabama in the section known as Las Cuadras. With medical studies barely completed, Romulo joined the Ministry of Health and Sports, working as a resident in the Aguirre II Community, located some kilometers from Sacaba. Romulo has worked in the Ministry of Health and Sports for approximately 4 years. The market is wide open, since the lack of doctors in the various provinces of our country is a major problem. Thanks to people such as Romulo, the poor in Bolivia’s most remote areas can have access to medical care. Romulo needs a loan to buy medical instruments in order to offer better service to the people in the community where he works, and thus be a better physician. His greatest dream is to some day have sufficient funds to open a clinic and help those who have little.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medical instruments

loans.name: Verónica Mercedes

texts.es:
Verónica Mercedes C. F., tiene 26 años.  Estado civil union libre  y vive con los hijos y con el compañero, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos, Darling  (10), Andy (9) y Erick (5).

Verónica es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Verónica se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y  fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar un carro y tener un negocio en Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta vender productos por medio de revista.
texts.en:
Verónica Mercedes C. F. is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with her children and companion in Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ríos. The names of her three children are Darling (age 10), Andy (age 9), and Erick (age 5).

Verónica is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Alto” (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and a half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture. This is the second loan they have received from Cooperativa San José.

Verónica is a farmer who grows rice and beans. She buys her supplies each month in the city of Ventanas and sells her products at the Peña commercial market which is in the same area.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice and beans. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams include buying a car and opening a business in Ventanas. The challenges she faces include the pests and diseases that can impact her crops.

Verónica enjoys products that are sold through magazines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice and beans

loans.name: Rosa Grimaneza

texts.es:
Rosa Grimaneza Q. T. tiene 27 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 1 hijo que se llama Rolando. 

Rosa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita esta préstamo para el trabajo de la agricultura. Con el apoyo del credito mejorara su situación economico de gastos de insumos. 

Le gusta jugar con su hijo en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Rosa Grimaneza Q. T. is 27 years old. She is married and lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has 1 son whose name is Rolando. Rosa is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús rural bank. There are 15 members in total and most of them work in agriculture. Rosa works in agriculture growing corn and cacao. She buys and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is asking for this loan for the agricultural work. With the support of this loan, she will improve her financial situation with the materials costs. She likes to play with her son in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Pedro Dario

texts.es:
Pedro Dario B. A., tiene 26 años.  Es soltero  y vive con los hermanos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Juan (14) y Yocelin (18).

Pedro es un soci de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz,  fréjol y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, fréjol y maiz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar un carro y tener un negocio en Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta rendir homenaje a Dios.
texts.en:
Dario B. Pedro A. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his brothers in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. He has two sons, Juan (14) and Yocelin (18). Pedro is a member of the "Valle Alto" communal bank, located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, about an hour and a half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of them working in agriculture. This is the second loan they are requesting through Cooperativa San José. Pedro works in agriculture. He plants rice, beans and corn. He makes his purchases once a month in Ventanas and sells his products in Comercial Peña or in the village. He requests the loan to buy rice, beans and corn seeds. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to progress. His dream is to buy a car and start a business in Ventanas. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases. He likes to pay homage to God.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans and corn seeds.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes C. Q. tiene 32 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 4 hijos que se llaman Miriam, Jonathan, Alex, y Dayona.  

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y arroz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para su agricultura. Con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejorara la situación económica de comprar insumos. Su sueno es comprar una tierra propia.  Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, una en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

En su tiempo libre arregla y hace todo las cosas en la casa.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes C. Q. is 32 years old. She is married and lives in the municipality of Ventanas, Los Rios province. She has four children called Miriam, Jonathan, Alex and Dayona. Maria is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús communal bank. There are 15 members in total, most of whom work in agriculture. Maria works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She buys and sells produce in the municipality of Ventanas. She requests a loan to buy raw materials for her agricultural business. The loan with improve her financial situation and enable her to buy raw materials. Her dream is to own land. A challenge she faces in her work is pests attacking corn crops, in particular the "longosta" type. In her free time she tidies her home and does the housework.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for agriculture.

loans.name: Maxima Narcisa

texts.es:
Maxima Narcisa G. R., tiene 27 años.  Es soltera  y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Mariuxi (6) y Antoni (11 meses).

Maxima es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.
