Maxima se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz,  fréjol y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, fréjol y maiz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar un carro y  una casa en la ciudad de Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta rendir homenaje a Dios.
texts.en:
Maxima Narcisa G. R. is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her children in Ventanas, a province of Los Ríos. She has two children: Mariuxi, age 6, and Antoni, age 11 months. Maxima is a member of the rural loan program, "Valle Alto," which is located in precinct Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half outside Ventanas. There are 23 group members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the group's second loan with the San José Cooperative. Maximo works in agriculture; she grows rice, beans, and corn. She does her shopping every month in the city of Ventanas, and she sells her products in the Peña market or the same place she shops. She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, beans, and corn. She believes the loan gives her the opportunity to get ahead in life. Her dreams are to buy a car and a house in the city of Ventanas. She faces challenges like plagues and sicknesses. She likes to pay tribute to God.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds of rice, beans, and corn

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olivia es una mujer madre de dos hijos, comerciante, desde hace varios años, logro poner una pulpería en donde vende variedad de productos,
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos ha mejorado el servicio en sus ventas y ahora con los financiamientos, de la institución ha mejorado el nivel de crecimiento.
Ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con poca mercadería, la que ha venido a mejorar con el apoyo de Afodenic.
Con sus préstamos aumenta la inversión, ya que lo que más desea es mantener en equilibrio sus ventas.
Es por eso comprara: cinco quintales de arroz,  tres quintales de frijoles, azúcar, maíz, bidones de aceite, productos lácteos, carne, pollo. Y otras variedades de productos logrando aumentar las ventas. Y así mejorar sus ganancias para pagar los gastos básicos y cubrir las necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Olivia is a trader and she has two children. Many years ago she succeeded in opening a corner shop where she sells a variety of products. Thanks to her husband and her children’s support, she has improved her selling service, and now, thanks to the loans obtained from this institution, she has sped up the growth pace of her activity, as when she started the amount of product she sold was small, but this has improved with Afodenic’s support. Since what she mostly desires is to keep her sales at balance, she uses her loans to invest, and with this one she will buy 5 quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of rice, 3 quintals of beans, sugar, maize, oil drums, dairy products, meat, chicken and a variety of other products, in order to succeeded in increasing her sales, thus improving her incomes and being able to pay for basic expenses and to cover her personal necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Verónica Yolanda

texts.es:
Verónica Yolanda Q. T. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Carmen y Anita. 

Verónica es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Verónica se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz, maíz, y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita esta préstamo para su agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta préstamo espera mejorar y seguir adelante. Su sueno es comprar una casa para su familia y un terreno propio. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Le gusta trabajar y cuando tiene tiempo libre, juega con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Verónica Yolanda Q. T. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has two children, Carmen and Anita. Verónica is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Verónica is a farmer, and she plants rice, corn, and cacao. She makes her purchases and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan for farming. With the support from this loan she hope to improve and get ahead. Her dream is to buy a house for her family and to buy her own piece of land. One of the challenges she faces in her work is the pest infestation of her corn. Specifically, one of them is called “longosta” (locust). She likes working, and when she has free time she plays with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Yolanda Beatriz

texts.es:
Yolanda Beatriz S. C. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. 

Yolanda es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Yolanda se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para seguir su agricultura y sembrar cacao. El préstamo lo ayudara en mejorar su situación economico. Su sueno es tener un propio terreno. 

En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda Beatriz S. C. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. Yolanda is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Yolanda grows corn and rice. She makes her purchases and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan to continue farming and to plant cacao. The loan will help her improve her economic situation. Her dream is to have her own land. In her free time she likes to play with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue farming and to plant cacao

loans.name: Sisa Chela

texts.es:
Sisa Chela S. M. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Fernando y Israel. 

Sisa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Sisa se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz, cacao, platano, y yuca. Hace las compras de sus productos en el cantón Echeondia y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. El apoyo del crédito mejorara su situación economico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, una en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨
texts.en:
Sisa Chela S. M. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has two children, Fernando and Israel. Sisa is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. She is a farmer, and she grows corn, cacao, bananas, and yucca. She makes her purchases in the Echeondia canton, and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan for farming. With the support from this loan she hopes to improve her economic situation. Her dream is to buy her own piece of land. One of the challenges she faces in her work is the pest infestation of her corn. Specifically, one of them is called “longosta” (locust).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Señora Alejandra L. es muy trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayuda mucho a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, tiene dos hijos pequeños y ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde corta pelo. Requieren este crédito ya que quiere cambiar la puerta de entrada de el lugar en donde la tiene actualmente, ya que la puerta esta en el lugar en donde quiere construir un cuarto para ahí colocar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandra L. is hardworking and entrepreneurial. Her husband helps her a lot with household expenses. They have 2 young children and Alejandra runs a small hair salon in her home. She needs this loan for construction. Alejandra plans to remove the front door and build an additional room where she can relocate her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change the front door.

loans.name: Juan Javier

texts.es:
El señor Javier trabaja en un Restaurant de Mesero, la mayor parte del día esta en su empleo, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar. Tienen una hija pequeña, ellos quieren una mejor calidad de vida para ellos y su pequeña hija. Es por eso que requieren de este préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto, levantando los muros y con unos ahorros que el tiene terminar el cuarto de su hija.
Para realizar su proyecto de vivienda necesita comprar el material para la construcción. El pasa la mayor parte del día en su empleo, es por eso que en la fotografía aparece solo su esposa.
texts.en:
Javier works at the Mesero Restaurant. He spends most of his day on the job, while his wife is a homemaker. They have a small daughter. They would like a better quality of life for themselves and their daughter. They are therefore asking for money to supplement their savings so that they can build a bedroom for their daughter and raise the walls of their house. In order to do these renovations, they must buy construction material. Because Javier spends most of his day at work, only his wife appears in this photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria R. R. tiene 20 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la província de Los Rios. Tiene 1 hija que se llama Silvia.

Luz es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Luz se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para avanzar en su agricultura. El apoyo de este préstamo ayudara la situación economica de gastos de insumos. Su sueno es tener un terreno. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

En su tiempo, trabaja y pasa tiempo con su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Maria R. R. is 20 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has a daughter named Silvia.

Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesús”. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Luz is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in the canton of Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan so that she can make progress in her farming activities. The support provided through these funds will help improve her financial situation and pay for supplies and expenses. Her dream is to acquire her own land. One challenge that she faces in her work is fighting pests that can ruin her corn. One specific pest is known as “langosta”.

Luz spends her time working and being with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her farming activities

loans.name: Lesbia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lesbia Del Carmen tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, actualmente se dedica a la compra venta de sal por quintal, también se dedica a la venta de leña pues se siente muy contenta de buscar el medio de vida. Ella realiza este negocio con apoyo de su esposo, el que la distribuye en un camión en otros departamentos del país. Pues es con este nuevo financiamiento pretende comprar mayor cantidad de sal, lo cual le generaría mayores ganancias y con esto seguir mejorando las condiciones de su hogar y darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Mantener este negocio es muy importante para ella, pues es la única fuente de empleo para mantener el hogar.
texts.en:
Lesbia Del Carmen is 34 years old and has two children. She sells salt for the garden and firewood and is happy to be able to make a living this way. Her husband helps her with this work--he has a truck to deliver the goods to different parts of the country. With more financing, Lesbia and her husband hope to buy more salt so they can generate more income and thereby improve their home and make more space for their children. Keeping up this business is essential to them, since it is the only way they have to maintain their home.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Nazareno inicia su séptimo ciclo con 13 socias que realizan diferentes actividades.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Rocío que es socia hace 2 años y presidenta en este ciclo, lo que mas le agrada es la capacitación Gals y lo esta poniendo en practica en su vida diaria.
Rocío es soltera , tiene 33 años y 2 hijas, Rocío venD. comida típica como mondongo en la puerta D. su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días sábados y domingos. Además Rocío es profesora D. primaria y brinda asesoramiento particular a niños, también es cosmetóloga y brinda servicios a domicilios como peinados y maquillajes.
Rocío necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mesas y sillas.
El sueño D. Rocío es ampliar su negocio y tener un restaurante y que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
El Nazareno community bank began its 7th loan cycle with 13 members, who all have different business activities. Rocío, a bank member for 2 years and president of her group this cycle, most enjoys the goals training which she puts into practice in her everyday life. Rocío is 33 years old and a single mother of 2 girls. She sells traditional food such as mondongo (a hearty stew of tripe and vegetables) from her home all day on the weekends. She is also a primary school teacher, teaching children basic education, as well as a cosmetologist, providing at-home hair styling and makeover services. Rocío needs a loan of 300 PEN to purchase tables and chairs. Her dream is to expand her business and start a restaurant. She hopes her daughters will have careers as educated professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer esforzada, vive junto con su familia, el cual todo se apoyan  para ayudar en su pequeño negocio una pulpería que ha venido administrando desde hace doce años.
Y que junto con Afodenic ha venido creciendo. Ya que cuando comenzó era poco el inventario a través de los financiamientos ha invertido en ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, y más en granos básicos ofreciendo al cliente 
Lo mejor.
Sus productos los compra en el mercado a proveedores, para lograr mejor precio y dar a buen precio al cliente.
Logrando a si mantener la clientela, lo que esta contenta ya que es su fuente de entrada para ayudar  a su esposo con los gastos.
Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos, golosinas, cajas de leche, caja de jabón, productos lácteos, ropa, zapatos, cosméticos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a resourceful woman who lives with her family: they all help her out with her activity, a small corner shop she has been running for twelve years, and which has been growing thanks to Afodenic’s support. She started with a small stock, and thanks to the loans she has managed to invest in clothes, shores, cosmetics and more basic grains, thus offering the best products to her customers. She buys her products in the wholesale market in order to obtain the best rates and so be able to offer fair prices that allow her to keep her customers, something she is happy about as this provides her with an income she can use to help her husband facing family expenses. This loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, sweets, milk cartons, bars of soap, dairy products, clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different products for her corner shop.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José, de 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El arduo trabajo que realiza todos los días en su negocio como es la venta de mercadería en general, le ha traído buenos resultados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hablar con sus clientes de los diferentes productos que le solicitan, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva más de 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es superara la competencia. Este es el primer crédito, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas con esto comprara calzado, perfumes, cremas y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Maria José is 42 years old. She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman, living in a house that she owns and whose biggest dream is to improve the quality of her life. She has obtained very good results from the hard work she does every day in her shop, where she sells various goods. What she likes the most about her job is talking to her customers about the different products they ask for, because then it’s when she feels her efforts are giving the best results. She has been running this activity for more than 6 years, and she considers facing competition to be the most difficult part. This is her first loan: she knows she has to make great efforts and work very hard to punctually repay her dues; the loan will be used to buy shoes, perfumes, creams and items of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: El señor Bernardo cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes y papelería, llamado “Papelería L.” el y su esposa tienen poco con el negocio, pero quieren que sea una tienda mas grande y con mas mercancía, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan, son una pareja joven y todavía no tienen hijos, pero quieren tener una estabilidad económica para cuando los tengan. El señor Bernardo requiere de este crédito para invertir en el negocio de la tienda, surtiendo mas abarrotes y así aumentar su clientela y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Bernardo runs a grocery store and stationary shop called Papelería L.. He and his wife have little in their shop, but they would like to have a larger store with more merchandise, since it is their only source of income. They are a young couple that don't have any children yet, but they would like to be financially stable when they do have them. Señor Bernardo will use the loan that he is requesting to buy more groceries to stock his store and thereby, increase his clientele and his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to stock his store

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad, tiene un hijo y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales dispersas alrededor de su pueblo central, que es el lugar donde se concentra todo la actividad comercial del distrito.

Desde hace nueve años se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral en su domicilio, el suele criar patos, los compra pequeños para luego engordarlos y cuando alcanzan un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que frecuentan el lugar donde vive. Este negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Aristides desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas pastos y alimento balanceado para lograr que estos se desarrollen de buena manera y percibir mayores ingresos al momento de su venta. Para lograr este objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Al realizar esta acción el podrá cubrir la demanda con la que cuenta ya que actualmente cuenta con varios pedidos por cumplir.

Arístides es una persona trabajadora y bastante responsable, en la zona donde vive sus conocidos le consideran alguien tranquilo y honrado. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Aristides is a 38 year old father with one child. He lives with his family in the Mórrope district, a district characterized as having the majority of its population concentrated in scattered, rural areas around a central village. This is where all the commercial activity in the district takes place. Nine years ago he started raising and selling poultry, mostly ducks, from home. He buys them young and fattens them up and when they have grown to a good size, he sells them to his neighbors and the dealers that frequent the area where he lives. This business allows him to cover his personal expenses and to support his family. Aristides wants to expand his business by buying more ducks and also, feed that will provide them with a balanced diet so that they are healthy and he can get a better price when he sells them. In order to achieve this goal he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). This will help him to meet the demand since he currently has several orders to fill. Aristides is hard-working and quite responsible. In the region where he lives he is known for being a peaceful and honest person. He has worked previously with our organization and has been punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase poultry to raise and sell and feed to expand his business

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Dolores tiene la edad de 44 años, madre de tres hijos, el cual tuvo que educar sola desde hace varios años, ya que se separo de su esposo.
No ha sido difícil pero nada imposible, junto a el y ha  sus esfuerzo hicieron su casa.
Trabaja como asistente administrativo para una fundación, pues con su salario cubre las necesidades alimenticias, pero no alcanza para poder hacer las mejoras a su casa.
Lo que le preocupa ya que en tiempo de invierno se le mete toda el agua por la calle ya que se inmunda debido a que los causes están llenos de basura, tiene unas reglas lo que hace que el agua se desvié pero cuando la lluvia es fuerte la bota.
La iniciativa para lograr esta mejora, es a través del financiamiento ya que los pagos son mensuales, lo que le permite equilibrar su dinero.
Para esta mejora comprara: piedra, cemento, arena, piedrin para hacer un pequeño muro, el cual ya pidió permiso a la alcaldía, y así lograr poder cerrar el desagüe. Y poder estar en mejores condiciones higiénica
texts.en:
Dona Dolores, 44, is the mother of three children. She had to raise the children alone for many years after she separated from her husband. It was difficult but she managed and, thanks to his efforts and hers, they built a house. Dona Dolores works as an administrative assistant for a foundation. Although her income from the job covers her everyday expenses, it's not enough for her to be able to improve the house. Dona Dolores worries that the house will be flooded in the winter because the streets are full of trash and water from the rains backs up in the streets and floods the area. She has some "reglas" (some kind of barrier, presumably) to divert the water away but when the rains are heavy, the reglas are not enough to stop the water. Dona Dolores can manage the improvements she wants to make with a loan because she can include the monthly payments in her budget. To make the improvements, she will buy stone, cement and sand to build a small wall--a project for which she already has approval from the city--and, consequently, stop the flooding. The project will improve the sanitary conditions of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build flood wall.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La señora Felipa se dedica a las labores del hogar, su esposo el señor José Margarito trabaja como obrero en una maquiladora. Tienen 3 hijos pequeños y una hija grande que también trabaja como obrera en una maquiladora, ella contribuye en los gastos de la casa. Sus tres hijos pequeños están en la escuela y la Señora Felipa necesita comprar los Útiles Escolares y Uniformes para los tres niños, es por eso que ella pide el apoyo de ustedes, para poder solventar estos gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Felipa is a housewife and her husband, Sr. Jose Margarito, works in a "maquiladora" (a factory in a free-trade zone). They have four children: three school-aged children and one grown daughter who also works in a maquiladora. The oldest daughter contributes to the family budget. The three younger children are in school and Sra. Felipa needs to buy school supplies and uniforms for them. It's for this purpose that she is asking for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and uniforms.

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marcia Del Socorro es una mujer de 42 años de edad, comerciante de una pequeña pulpería que ha venido invirtiendo con dinero propio pues no es el primer financiamiento por lo que con ellos ha podido salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Pues ha logrado mantener estable su negocio, solo que algunas veces no tiene el capital para seguir invirtiendo, por lo que con el tiempo y la experiencia han sido los factores fundamentales para continuar. 
Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos, que es el alimento principal, lácteos, carne, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcia Del Socorro, 42, operates a small corner shop which she has developed, in part, with her own money. However, this isn't her first loan and she has used past loans to get ahead and improve the quality of her life. Although she has managed to stablilize her business, there are times when she doesn't have enough to cover her operational expenses and she has to rely on time and experience to go on. She will use this loan to buy the products she sells: staple grains, dairy products, meat, candy, cold drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Alberto es Albañil, tiene tres hijos pequeños. Quiere ir mejorando su calidad de vida; es por ello que ha ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco para ofrecer a su familia comodidad y un buen patrimonio para el futuro. El señor quiere poner la losa de concreto en un cuarto que tiene en la parte trasera de su vivienda. El Señor Luis Alberto les agradece la ayuda para realizar su Proyecto de su Vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a bricklayer. He has three small children. He wants to improve his quality of life. Little by little he has been building his house in order to make his family comfortable and to give them a good inheritance in the future. He wants to pour a concrete slab in a room in the back of his house. Luis Alberto is grateful for the help on his home project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab

loans.name: Hosanna Jabneel

texts.es: Hosanna es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, tiene un hijo pequeño de dos años y vive sola con el ya que desde hace un tiempo vive separada de su esposo. Ella se preocupa por el bienestar de ella y de su bebe, es por eso que esta solicitando este crédito, por que quiere colocar una barda en la parte del frente de la vivienda, para  ofrecerle a su hijo un patrimonio seguro. Y también para sentirse ella misma mas tranquila cuando esta sola con su hijo.
texts.en:
Hosanna is a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She lives alone with her small two year old son. She has been separated from her husband for some time. She worries about her well-being and that of her baby. That is why she is requesting this loan. She wants to place a wall in the front part of her house. She wants to do this to give her son a secure inheritance. She also wants to feel that she is not worried when she is alone with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Bimala N..  She is married and has four children, aged 14, 10, 8 and 3.  In five years, she established her shop business, and   working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. Bimala has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and is using her most recent loan to increase the inventory in her shop.  

In the future, Bimala plans to continue her business.  She thanks you for your support.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates on the BPW Partner Page.     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: increase the inventory in her shop

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe Esmeralda

texts.es: La Señora Ana Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora, que le gusta siempre ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como profesor en una escuela primaria y ella vende nieve y comida rápida. Ella requiere de este crédito para invertir al negocio, y así obtener mayores ganancias y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija pequeña.
texts.en:
Ana Guadalupe is a hard-working woman who always likes to help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband works as a teacher in an elementary school. She sells ice-cream and fast food. She needs this loan to invest in her business. That way she will get more income and be able to give her little daughter a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 28 años D. edad, es soltera, actualmente asume el cargo D. tesorera D. la alcancía comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad, desD. hace 5 años y medio, su alcancía comunal está conformada por 10 socios y se encuentra ubicada en El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, los socios realizan actividades como comercio y servicio. Silvia se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa por temporada como ambulante desD. hace 6 meses, se inicio a raíz que su familia la animó y apoyo para implementar su pequeño negocio, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo solo logra ahorrar lo poco que gana para poder invertirlo en su negocio. El gran sueño D. Silvia es tener un negocio propio D. ropas interiores y joyas.
El reciente préstamo será utilizado para la construcción D. su vivienda, todos los participantes D. la alcancía están muy contentos y agradecidos por la ayuda que se les brinda. (Niños en la foto hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
Silvia is 28 years old, single, and has become treasurer of the “María Elena Moyano” communal bank. This bank has worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad (Prosperity) for 5 ½ years. The bank is composed of 10 members and is located in El Agustino, department of Lima. All the members carry out activities relating to commerce and services. Silvia has bought and sold seasonal clothing in the streets for the last 6 months. She began because her family encouraged and helped her to start her small business. By means of her work alone, she saved the little that she earned to be able to invest in her business. Silvia's grand dream is to have a business selling underwear and jewelry. This recent loan will be used to construct her house. All the participants in the communal bank are very content and grateful for the help they are offered. (The children in the photo belong to the members.)

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCTING HER HOUSE

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito D. San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Placida; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y la socia es casada ella estudió la secundaria incompleta debido a la falta D. dinero que padeció en su hogar ella desD. muy chica se dedicó a trabajar para ayudar a hermanos menores; La socia venD. pasto y también jora que es uno D. los principales ingredientes para elaborar la chicha D. jora. (maíz amarillo macerado). La socia venD. la jora por las mañanas y entrando las 5 D. la tarD. ella sale a vender en la puerta D. su casa pasto, estos días ala socia estuvo vendiendo su pasto en la puerta D. la casa D. su vecina delante D. una tienda, ella es una mujer muy alegre y con muchas ganas D. progresar en la vida, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz amarillo y elaborar la jora para la venta D. chicha.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank "Señor D. los Milagros D. Chimpahuaylla"; She lives in the San Jerónimo district of Chimpahuayylla in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Mrs. Placida; she's 57-years-old and married. She didn't finish high school due to the lack of money in her household. Since she was very young she's worked to help her younger siblings. She sells grass and jora (yellow maize), which is one of the principal ingredients in making chicha D. jora (a fermented corn beverage popular in Peru). She sells the jora in the mornings and at 5:00 p.m. she starts selling grass from her home. These days she sells grass from her neighbor's house in front of a store. She's a very happy woman with ambition to progress in life. She's asking for the loan to buy yellow maize to sell chicha. She's very grateful for this loan because it permits her to grow her business and have a better quality of life; she promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yellow maize to make chicha

loans.name: Betty Yliana

texts.es:
Betty es una madre D. familia D. 44 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijas en el distrito D. Pueblo Nuevo, un distrito perteneciente a L. provincia D. Chepén ubicada en L. región L. Libertad, a mas D. una hora D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a L. venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en L. casa donD. vive, elL. ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo D. productos D. uso diario que usualmente son D. difícil acceso por lo que su negocio siempre cuenta con acogida D. parte D. sus clientes. Esta actividad es importante para su familia porque gracias a elL. Betty pueD. ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.

Betty necesita ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. mas productos D. modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo L. demanda D. sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que contribuyan al logro D. su objetivo.

ElL. es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, elL. se esfuerza constantemente para salir adelante ya que desea ver a su familia progresar. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Betty, age 44, lives with her husband and their three daughters in the Pueblo Nuevo district. This district belongs to the Chepén province in the L. Libertad region. It is over an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells basic needs products and groceries in a store set up in her home. She sells all types of products for daily use, which are usually difficult to get. That is why her business is always well-received by her customers. This activity is important for her family. Thanks to the business, Betty is able to help her husband cover the family expenses. Betty needs to expand her business by purchasing more products so that she can continue to satisfy her customer demand. That is why she is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which will contribute to achieving her objective. She is a hard-working woman who is very devoted to her family. She constantly strives to get ahead because she wants to see her family make progress. She has worked with our institution previously, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility about making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products and groceries to expand the store in her house

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 51 años. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que dependen de ella. Su actividad es la elaboración de cepillos, pastes de baño. Por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy emprendedora. Pues tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación. Este financiamiento que está realizando es para la compra de materia prima como  hilo, esponja, telas, cloro y leña entre otras cosas. El sueño que siempre le gustaría cumplir es establecer un taller en donde pueda ofrecer trabajo a personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 51 and has 3 dependent children. She makes brushes and washcloths. Rosa has always been very industrious and she has worked with the Foundation for a long time. This loan will be used to buy basic supplies such as thread, sponges, fabric, bleach and firewood, etc. The dream that she always has had is to set up a shop where she can offer employment to people who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Lucia; ella tiene 34 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera y tiene 1 hija, ella tiene estudios superiores de enfermería, la socia trabaja cuidando ancianos, ella está ahora cuidando a una anciana que está enferma en casa, la socia en sus ratos libres se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa de forma ambulante, ella vende a sus amigas y gente conocida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor y vender.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA” communal bank. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla, the province and department of Cusco. Lucia is a 34 year old single mother with one daughter. She studied nursing at the university level and works as a caregiver for the elderly. She is currently caring for an elderly woman who is sick at home. In her spare time, she has a business in which she works as a street vendor, selling clothing. She sells to her friends and people she knows. She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale clothing for resale. Lucia is grateful for the loan as it will allow her to grow her business and have a better quality of life. In addition, she promises to make her payments according to the agreed upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy wholesale clothing for resale

loans.name: Makhamali

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Makhamali L..  She is married and has three children aged 14, 12 and 5.  In 2010, she established her vegetable selling business.  Working five days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to increase the inventory in her store.  In the future, Makhamali plans to continue and increase her business.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh vegetables are purchased from the local farmers and sold.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for selling

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Noemi; ella tiene 35 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera, su pareja la abandonó por otra mujer, ella tienen 2 hijos y desde entonces es madre y padre para sus dos pequeños hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus dos trabajos, ella trabaja en una fábrica de lácteos en el distrito de Oropesa situado a 20 minutos de su barrio; La socia también se dedica a vender granos secos para la venta los fines de semana en el mercado vino canchón, ella vende  (maíz de diferentes variedades, pallares, cereales, frijoles, lentejas, entre otros productos secos.), La socia desea juntar dinero para los estudios de sus hijos y darles a ellos una mejor calidad de vida, ella también quiere comprar muebles y mejorar su casita; La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Noemi belongs to the “Señor de los Miagros de Chimpahuaylla” Communal Bank, and lives in the San Jerónimo district of Chimpahuaylla province, Cusco district. She is 35 years old and a single mother, her partner having abandoned her for another woman. Noemi has 2 children and since being abandoned, has been mother and father to them both. She alternates her household activities with working in a dairy plant in the Oropesa distract, some 20 minutes from her barrio. Noemi also sells dry grains on weekends in the Vino Canchón Market. She sells different varieties of corn, and harvests of cereals, beans, and lentils, among other dry products. Noemi wants to accumulate money for her children's studies and to provide them with a better quality of life. She also wishes to buy furniture and improve her little house. Noemi is soliciting a loan to buy dry grains to sell. She values and appreciates the offered loan, since it will permit her to grow and have a better quality of life, and she promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING DRY GRAINS TO SELL

loans.name: Las Flores De Fortin Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la  casa  de Inocencia M., un integrante del grupo  Las Flores de Fortín, que está ubicado en el Estado de  Veracruz  en México. Se ve  la entrada de la casa en donde se ubica la papelería de la señora Inocencia  en la foto. Ella se dedica a  la venta de artículos de papelería y regalos  que inició hace  3  años. Solicita el préstamo para  pagar mercancía que ya encargó pues se acerca la entrada a clases y tiene que estar bien surtida . Sus clientes  la ven como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Su papelería se ubica cerca de dos escuelas que son las que lo mantienen rentable . Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente  entusiasmada ya que se acerca una buena temporada de ventas. Tiene  58 años, estudio hasta el 6 año de primaria, vive en unión libre y tiene en total  4 hijos 3 mujeres y 1 varones. Quiere este crédito para pagar mercancía que ya pidió como libretas cuadernos plastilina y regalos También espera  el negocio le pueda ayudar a mejorar su vida y de esta forma apoyar a su hija con la crianza de sus nietos.
Salome A.   es la presidenta del grupo Las Flores de Fortín estudió hasta el tercer año de preparatoria y tiene en total  1 hija. Ella se dedica a venta de lencería que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para iniciar la venta de pasteles.
El grupo esta conformado por 12 de integrantes. Los otros integrantes son:
Yasmín S.(venta de verdura), 
Petra M.(venta de antojitos), 
Gladis M.(venta de comida), 
María Basilisa M. (venta de gorditas), 
Marcela Natalia A. (venta de cloro), 
Camerina L. (venta de pan), 
Matilde L. (venta de cosméticos), 
Concepción M. (bordados y tejidos), 
Gloria E. (Papelería) y 
Yuly Vianey E. (Renta de cuatrimotos)
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Inocencia M.’s house. She is a member of the Las Flores de Fortín (The Flowers of Fortín) group, which is located in the state of Veracruz, Mexico. You can see her in the entrance to her house, which is where her stationery store is located. She has been selling stationery products and gifts for three years. She is requesting the loan to pay for merchandise she ordered. School will soon be starting, and she has to be well stocked. Her customers see her as a responsible and hard-working person. Her stationery store is located close to two schools, and they keep her business profitable. She is enthusiastic about requesting the loan because the season for good sales is approaching. She is 58 years old, and she has a sixth grade education. She is in a common-law marriage; and she has four children, three girls and a boy. She wants this loan to pay for merchandise that she has already requested. She will buy things like notebooks, folders, clay, and gifts. She also hopes that the business will be able to help her improve her life. That way she can help her daughter raise her grandchildren. Salome A. is the president of the Las Flores de Fortín group. She went to school until her third year of high school. She has one daughter. She has been selling lingerie for two years. She is requesting a loan to start selling pastries. The group is comprised of 12 members. The other members are: Petra M.(sells snacks), Gladis M.(sells food), María Basilisa M. (sells “gorditas”, which are small, thick, corn flour tortillas), Marcela Natalia A. (sells bleach), Camerina L. (sells bread), Matilde L. (sells cosmetics), Concepción M. (embroidery and weavings), Gloria E. (stationery store), and Yuly Vianey E. (rents four wheel drive ATV)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for merchandise

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
Don  Francisco  de 37 años d edad, viven con su esposa y sus hijos menores de edad que son tres y los tiene estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. 
Don francisco tiene su propio negocio taller de zapatos, desde hace 17 años el elabora sus zapatos para caballeros y niños de todo estilo y tipo. Su producto es de calidad y buscado por mayoristas y minorista por su comodidad, estilo y precio.
 Ha tenido dificultades de que algunos clientes no le pagan al tiempo estipulado. 
 Lo inicio con pocas cantidades de pedido lo cuales con el tiempo han aumentado, siempre ha trabajado en su taller solo que fue más pequeño que ahora.
Con este crédito comprara materia prima, ya que desea seguir aumentado la producción en mercadería como cuero, hilo, nylon pega de zapato, tinta, entre otras para lograr hacer sus estilo de zapatos.
texts.en:
Francisco, 37-years-old, lives with his wife and three young children who study at the local school. For 17 years Francisco has had his own shoe-making shop specializing in shoes of many types for men and children. He produces a quality product that is sought out by wholesalers and retailers for its comfort, style, and price. He's had difficulties with some customers failing to pay him on time. He began his business with few orders, but over time demand has increased. He's always worked in his workshop--the only difference is that it used to be smaller. With this loan he will by raw materials such as leather, thread, nylon, shoe glue, and dye because he wants to continue expanding production of merchandise and make his particular style of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as leather, nylon, and glue to increase his production of shoes

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Nirmala B..  She is married and has four children, aged 11, 7, 6 and 2.  In 2010, she established her business.  Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to increase the inventory in her store.  In the future, Nirmala plans to continue and increase her grocery business.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: increase the inventory in her shop

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Mariluz; ella tiene 28 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera ella tiene 1 hijo y es padre y madre para su menor hijito, ella es la única encargada de proveerle a su menor hijo el abrigo, alimento y todo tipo de cuidados y necesidades el se requiera en el desarrollo de su menor hijo; La socia tiene dos trabajos en los que juntando los dos sueldos llega hacer el básico vital para sustentarse, La socia trabaja haciendo la limpieza en un hostal en la calle Huáscar y independientemente ella también compra artesanías para la venta los fines de semana en la plaza de Túpac Amaru, La socia se mantiene muy ocupada con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su menor hijo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía y continuar ayudándose con este otro negocio.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; she lives in the district of San Jerónimo in Chimpahuaylla in the province and department of Cusco. Mariluz is 28-years-old and the single mother of 1 child. She's father and mother for her little child; she's the only one responsible for providing shelter, food, and all the basic necessities for raising a child. Between the wages from two jobs she manages to make enough to support herself. She works as a cleaning woman in a hostel on Huáscar street, and as an independent retailer of handicrafts on the weekend in the Túpac Amaru plaza. She stays very busy trying to improve her quality of life for herself and her child. She's asking for this loan to buy handicrafts so that she can continue supporting herself with this side business. She's very grateful for the loan because it will help her grow her business and achieve a better quality of life. She promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of handicrafts

loans.name: Acuario Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Proselita socia entusiasta y emprendedora, tiene 59 años D. edad, conviviente,  tiene 4 hijos  que son el motivo D. su vida, su domicilio está ubicado en la urb. Sol D. Vitarte – Ate, departamento D. Lima.  Actualmente ocupa el cargo D. Tesorera D. la alcancía comunal “ACUARIO” la cual está conformado por 7 socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades: venta D. productos D. belleza, wawa wasi, a la venta D. ropas y otros, la alcancía comunal  trabaja con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad desD. hace  8  meses. 
Proselita se dedica a la venta D. bebidas (gaseosas, cerveza), tiene 59 años en este negocio, ella se inicio en un mercado llamado “SOL D. VITARTE”, logro tener un ahorro y poner el negocio en su vivienda, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo logro terminar la construcción D. su vivienda y apoyar en los estudios D. su hija quien estudia en una universidad particular, ya que el gran anhelo D. Proselita es que su hija obtenga su título profesional y que sus hijos tengan una vivienda donD. vivir. Con el préstamo obtenido realizara la compra D. mercadería para implementar su negocio, todos nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos por el apoyo a la micro empresa y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos en los plazos pactados. (Niños en la foto hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
Proselita is an enthusiastic and enterprising partner. She's 59-years-old, lives with a common-law husband, and has 4 children who are her motivation in life. Her house is located in Sol D. Vitarte in the department of Lima. Currently she acts as treasurer in the communal bank "ACUARIO," which is composed of 7 partners who perform various activities: sale of beauty products, wawa wasi (young child care in Peru), clothing sales, and others. The communal bank has worked with EDARPROSPO-Prosperity for 8 months. Proselita has sold drinks (sodas, beer) for 59 years. She began in a market called "SOL D. VITARTE," where she saved up enough money to move her business to her home. With much hard work she finished the construction of her home and helped support her daughter, who studies in a private university. Proselita's greatest hope is that her daughter obtains her professional degree and that her sons have a place to live. With this loan she will buy merchandise to expand her business. All of our partners are very grateful for the support of the micro-company and they promise to make their payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 51 años de edad y la socia es viuda y  ella tiene 4 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene su peculiar carrito en el cual incorporó sus ollas y los mantiene calientitos con esas mantas gruesas que envuelven las ollas; ell lleva a vender al mercado vino canchón y sus diferentes platos de comida, ella es una excelente cocinera por lo que su arte le ha valido para mantenerse toda la vida con sus negocio de comidas, pero La socia ha comprado unas ovejitas tiernas y ahora que crecieron ella las vende también en el mercado, este negocio le está ayudando a nmejorar su economía y está pensando en adquirir unos cuantos ovinos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar sus comiditas y comprar gas.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; she lives in the district of San Jerónimo in Chimpahuaylla in the province and department of Cusco. Hilda is 51-years-old. She's a widow with 4 children. She alternates domestic duties with commercial retail. She has her own cart that holds her pots that she keeps warm with thick blankets. She brings her cart to the Vino Canchón market to sell various dishes. She's an excellent cook, and this art has maintained her all her life in her food business. She's also bought some young sheep and now that they're grown she sells them in the market. This business is helping her improve her finances and she's thinking about acquiring a few more sheep. She's asking for the loan to buy supplies for her food and to buy gas. She's grateful for the loan because it will permit her to grow her business and have a better quality of life. She promises to make her payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make food

loans.name: Marling Norelly

texts.es: Mailing Norelly tiene la edad de 24 años, Ella se dedica a la actividad económica como es el la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ella pagaba por la ropa que compraba era el doble así descubrió que este negocio es muy rentable, por lo que ya tiene experiencia en financiamiento. El negocio al principio fue difícil porque no tenía capital, suficientes su primer préstamo lo invirtió para comprar algunas prendas como camisas, pantalones y blusas, la ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar una gran variedad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Marling Norelly is 24-years-old. For over 6 years she's sold merchandise general merchandise. When she first paid for her clothes she realized that they were marked up to double their value, and that retail was a profitable business, especially because she already had finance experience. The business was difficult at first because she didn't have sufficient capital. She invested her first loan in the purchase of garments such as shirts, pants, and blouses. Her business is located in her modest home. She's asking for this loan to purchase a great variety of garments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 35 años de edad y la socia es casada y tiene 2 menores hijos, ella tiene su stand en el mercado vino canchón ella vende granos secos (todas las variedades de maíz, frijoles, lentejas, porotos, pallares, moraya y otros) La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y compra al por mayor las semillas para luego venderlos en su stand, La socia ayuda en la educación de la familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor. 

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA” ["Lord of the Miracles of Chimpahuaylla"] communal bank. She lives in Chimpahuaylla, in the district of San Jerónimo and the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Isabel, and she is 35 years old and married with 2 young children. She has a stand in the Vino Canchón market where she sells dry grains and beans (all of the varieties of corn, lentils, red beans, white beans, lima beans, moraya [dried potatoes], etc.). She is a very hard-working woman, and she buys her products wholesale to sell from her stand. She is helping pay for her children's education. Isabel is requesting this loan to buy dry products on a wholesale basis. Isabel values and appreciates the loan offered to her, since it will permit her to make progress and to have a better quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying dry products on a wholesale basis

loans.name: Santa Lucia New Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la  casa  de  Rosalina V. , integrante del grupo  Santa Lucía New, que está ubicado en el Estado de  Veracruz  en México. Se ve  al fondo de la foto el negocio de florería y bisutería de la señora Rosalina. Ella se dedica a  la venta de anturios y artículos de bisutería, papelería y regalos que inicio hace  6  años. Solicita el préstamo para  invertir en su negocio y meterle un poco de abarrotes para darle más variedad a su negocio. Sus clientes  la consideran una persona muy trabajadora. El negocio se ubica en la parte de enfrente de su casa. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente  muy contenta porque podrá hacerlo crecer un poco. Tiene  64 años, estudió hasta el  6to. año  de primaria, vive  unión libre  y tiene en total  3  hijos (  1  mujer y 2  varones). Quiere este crédito para  invertir en más mercancía y comprar abarrotes para tenerlo más surtido. También espera  mejorar sus ingresos para poder ampliar su casa y construir un techo más resistente ya que cuando hay suradas o viento fuerte, el techo que es de lámina actualmente se ha caído en varias ocasiones.
 Ana Laura L.  es la presidente del grupo. Tiene  29 años, estudió hasta el 3er. año de Secundaria, es   casada   y tiene en total  2  hijos  varones. Ella se dedica a  la venta de artículos de papelería que inició hace  7  años. Solicita el préstamo para  comprar papelería para seguir vendiendo.
El grupo esta conformado por  11  de integrantes quienes son:
Anselma H. (venta de calzado,) 
Eufrosina S. (venta de abarrotes), 
María Luisa H. (venta de abarrotes), 
Rocío M. (venta de calzado), 
Araceli P. (Venta de Comida),
Margarita N. (venta de abarrotes), 
Mónica D. (venta de ropa), 
Lourdes O. (venta de antojitos), 
María Guadalupe O. (venta de antojitos)
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Rosalina V., member of the SANTA LUCIA NEW Group which is located in Veracruz, Mexico. At the bottom of the photo, you can see Ms. Rosalina’s flower and costume jewelry shop. For the past 6 years, she has been selling anthuriums, costume jewelry, stationery, and gifts. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and plans to add some groceries to her inventory in order to offer more variety. Her customers regard her as a very hard-worker. The business is located in the front part of her home. When applying for this loan, she felt very happy because she knew she would be able to make her business grow a bit. She is 64 years old, studied up to the 6th year of primary school, lives in a common-law relationship and has 3 children (one daughter and two sons). She wants this loan to invest in more merchandise and buy groceries so that her shop will be better stocked. In addition, she hopes to increase her income in order to be able to expand her house and build a more weather resistant roof as the laminate roof she has at present has fallen on numerous occasions during the suradas (strong South winds). . Ana Laura L. is president of the group. She is 29 years old, studied up to the 3rd year of secondary school, is married and has 2 sons. She has been selling stationery for the past 7 years. She is requesting this loan to buy stationery in order to maintain sales. The group is made up of the following 11 members: Anselma H. (footwear sales) Eufrosina S. (grocery sales) María Luisa H. (grocery sales) Rocío M. (footwear sales) Araceli P. (food sales) Margarita N. (grocery sales) Mónica D. (clothing sales) Lourdes O. (snack sales) María Guadalupe O. (snack sales)

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stationery in order to maintain sales

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el caserío Sebastopol del distrito agrícola de Pacanga, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Chepén de la región La Libertad, ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura y al comercio desde que era mas joven, el cuenta con algunas cabezas de ganado vacuno de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen entre sus vecinos. Adicionalmente cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar alfalfa, la cual comercializa diariamente en el mercado de Pacanguilla (un pueblo cercano), con esta actividad el solventa los gastos de su familia por lo que siempre trata de esforzarse para salir adelante .

Arnaldo desea mejorar su negocio de ganadería comprando alimento balanceado para alimentar a sus vacas, esta acción le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos ya que la producción mejorará en cantidad y calidad, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Arnaldo siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, por ello trabaja sin cesar. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is a 35-year-old father who lives with his wife and child in the settlement of Sebastopol in the agricultural district of Pacanga, which belongs to Chepén province in La Libertad region and lies more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has dedicated himself to work related to agriculture and trade since he was a young man. He has several head of cattle, and he sells the milk they produce to his neighbors. He also has a small plot of farmland where he usually plants alfalfa, which he sells each day at the market in Pacanguilla (a nearby village). With this activity, he is able to cover his family's expenses, and he is always trying to put forth extra effort to get ahead. Arnaldo wants to improve his cattle business by purchasing nutritionally balanced feed for his cows. This initiative will help him earn a better income, since the cows' production will improve in both quality and quantity. To achieve his objective, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. Arnaldo is always working hard to help his family get ahead; he works unceasingly for this purpose. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and others who know him consider him an honest and hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying balanced feed to improve his dairy cows' production

loans.name: Lourdes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lourdes es mujer esforzada, madre de tres hijos, comerciante desde hace catorce años en donde ha venido aumentando el nivel de ventas.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con poca mercadería y gracias  a su tenacidad ha venido incrementando su pequeña pulpería, por años. 
A si mismo Hoy en día tiene poco inventario ya que ha estado un poco mal de salud, y gastado mucho en medicamento, con ayuda de su esposo ha salido a delante ya que también el trabaja como pequeño comerciante en la venta de carne de res.
También a través del apoyo con los financiamientos de Afodenic ha logrado incrementar y equilibrar sus ventas ya que es su cuarto crédito que ha venido pagando mensualmente. Lo que le permite poder cumplir con su pago y pagar también sus gastos básicos.
Con este préstamo comprara: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosa, productos enlatados y otros logrando poder aumentar el inventario y vender mas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a hard-working woman and the mother of three children. She has been a businesswoman for fourteen years, during which she has gradually increased her sales volume. When she began, she had only a little merchandise, but thanks to her tenacity, she has gradually expanded her little food store over the years. Currently, she is low on inventory, because she has suffered a few health problems and has spent a lot of money on medicines. With her husband's help, she has gotten through this situation, since he also works as a small businessman, selling beef. Also through the support of loans from Afodenic she has been able to increase and stabilize her sales. This is her fourth loan, and she has been making monthly payments. This permits her to make her payments while also covering her basic expenses. With this loan, she will buy basic grains, dairy products, snacks, soft drinks, canned goods and other items, so that she can increase her inventory and sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, dairy products and other items to increase her sales

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.en:
Gaudencio is a humble and hardworking family-oriented businessman. He has over ten years of experience as a salesman and two years ago opened his own business. His storefront business sells CDs, records, clothing, and gifts. Gaudencio’s wife and one of his sisters help him run the store. His business attracts the growing Latino population in his community.

One of Gaudencio’s greatest challenges is that he doesn’t always have the goods that his customers are looking for. With his second ACCION USA loan, Gaudencio will be able to diversify his inventory by purchasing more clothing and Mexican accessories. This will allow him to retain more customers who come into his store looking for specific items. 

Gaudencio has enjoyed being his own boss and generating extra income for his family. He felt the hardships of the economic crisis when no bank would lend to him. Receiving a loan from ACCION USA has allowed him to maintain his business and support his family. Gaudencio hopes to continue growing his business so that his family will be well off some day.


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Additional inventory, including clothing and Mexican accessories

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa moved to the United States from Ecuador in 1999 with her family. In Ecuador she received her degree in Business Administration and practiced in the field for 25 years. When she moved to the United States, she didn’t speak English very well, so she wasn’t able to get a job in her field. In 1999, just months after moving to Boston, she started her own day care. 

Starting her own business has allowed Teresa to provide an additional income for her family. She enjoys working with the children and owning her own business. The income generated from her day care also allowed her family to purchase the house in which they are living. 

Teresa’s greatest challenge is the summer months. Between June and August many families take their children out of the day care for vacation and summer camps. During these months, Teresa has a hard time maintaining her cash flow and paying her three employees. Another challenge has been that many parents took their children out of day care during the economic crisis. Many decided to take care of their children at home instead of paying for her services.

This is Teresa’s 2nd loan with ACCION USA, with which she’ll be better able to maintain her business and pay employees during the summer months. She hopes to be better prepared for low attendance next summer, so that she doesn’t run into this problem again. She knows that come September she will be back up to capacity in her day care. Teresa’s day care is well known in the greater Boston area and she receives many new clients through referrals.


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To maintain cash flows & employees during slower summer months

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene la edad de 41 años, comerciante de una miscelánea muy surtida que gracias a mucho esfuerzos y con créditos que Afodenic a otorgado durante un periodo de diez ciclos,  por medios de sus préstamo logro la inversión.
Ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con poco capital, propio producto de sus venta de fritanga, y de carpintería que hace años era su oficio.
Las dificultades que tiene es cuando se va la luz, ya que hay productos que se friegan rápido y es una perdida para el.
Sus productos los compra a proveedores para lograr comprar más barato y poder dar a mejor precio a  sus clientes.
Con esta inversión comprara granos básicos: diez quintales de arroz, diez quintales de azúcar, cuatro de frijoles, gaseosas, elevar la compra de pollo y lácteos para lograr aumentar las ventas. y poder seguir sastifaciendo al cliente con sus productos.
texts.en:
Juan is 41 years old. He is an entrepreneur with a well-stocked grocery store, thanks to his intense efforts and the help of loans from Afodenic, which have been granted to him over a period of ten loan cycles. He was able to continue investing in his business thanks to his loans. When he began, he had very little capital, only what he had saved from selling fried food and his carpentry work, which was his profession years ago. His difficulties include power outages, since some of his products spoil quickly and this is a loss for him. He buys his products from wholesale suppliers so he can buy more cheaply and offer better prices to his customers. With this investment, he will buy basic foods, including ten quintals [100-pound sacks] of rice, ten quintals of sugar, four quintals of beans, and soft drinks. He will also buy more chicken and dairy products in order to increase his sales and continue satisfying his customers with his products.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of merchandise to expand his inventory and increase his sales

loans.name: Nicolasa Carolina

texts.es:
Doña Nicolasa  tiene la edad de 43 años,  pequeña comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortilla, desde hace varios años, tiene 43 años, vive junto con su familia.
Inicio con poco dinero que dio su esposo, el cual para ella fue su inicio, que luego logro aumentar su producción de venta. Con Afodenic ha trabajado por diez ciclos lo que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, inversión en su tortillería que es su medio para lograr ingresos y lograr pagar sus gastos básicos como necesidades personales.

Con este crédito hará un muro el cual podrá tener mejor  seguridad de su casa como la higiene, con el crédito anterior ese era su destino pero no lo logro por que tuvo que cambiar el techo de su casa que le fue más de necesidad.
Ahora comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzara hacer el muro, logrando así comenzar la obra y gozar de los beneficios a través de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 43 years old and a small business owner. She has sold tortillas for several years. She lives with her family. She started with a little money that her husband gave her and that was the beginning for her and later she was able to increase her sales.
