Eleuterio nació en la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente  vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposa y sus hijos a quienes brindar amor y respeto. 

Eleuterio tiene 37 años y se decidida a la venta de ropa, Actualmente, Eleuterio le pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta que está ubicado en la calle Trinitarias de la ciudad Cusco, los 7 días de las semana, desde las 9 mañana hasta bastante tarde. Hace 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Eleuterio espera recibir $400 USD. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo camisas, pantalones, etc.  

Eleuterio pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.
texts.en:
Eleuterio was born in Cusco and currently lives there with his wife and children, whom the couple offers love and respect. Eleuterio is 37 years old and sells clothes for a living. You can find Eleuterio in his market stall located on Cusco's Trinitarias street seven days a week from 9 in the morning until very late. He has sold clothes for ten years, and he is doing very well. With his next loan, Eleuterio hopes to receive $400 USD. He would like to use the money to buy merchandise like shirts, pants, etc. Eleuterio belongs to the community bank "El Amanecer" ("The Dawn"). He has participated in the community bank for multiple loan cycles, and the group has reaffirmed his confidence in loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jimmi Alberto

texts.es:
Jimmi nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Jimmi estudio en la Universidad  Andina del Cusco la carrera profesional de Odontología y tiene 31 años. Al terminar su carrera profesional se asocio al consultorio “SMILE” de tres amigos de su misma carrera profesional.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Jimmi espera recibir $800 USD. Por el momento, el consultorio esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar un equipo de ultra sonido, aparato eléctrico para remover placa y para una cuota inicial de una máquina de rayos x.  

Jimmi pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.  El sueño del socio es abrir consultorios en las ciudades de Quillabamba y Urubamba.
texts.en:
Jimmi was born in the city of Quillabamba and currently lives in the city of Cusco. He is 31 years old, and he studied the professional specialty of Odontology at the Andean University of Cusco. Upon finishing his degree, he associated himself with a clinic called "SMILE," run by three friends with the same professional specialty. For his next loan, Jimmi hopes to receive $800 U.S. dollars. At present, the clinic is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. He would like to use the funds to buy ultrasound equipment and an electric apparatus to remove plaque, and to make an initial payment for an x-ray machine. Jimmi belongs to the communal bank called “El Amanecer” ["The Dawn"]. He has participated in his communal bank through several previous loan cycles, and they have reaffirmed his confidence in the loans. His dream is to open clinics in the cities of Quillabamba and Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying an ultrasound machine and an electrical apparatus to remove plaque, and making an initial payment for an x-ray machine

loans.name: Christian Israel

texts.es:
Christian Israel tiene 23 anos. Vive en union libre con su esposa y su hija de 11 meses. 

Christian es un socio de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Christian se dedica a la agricultura. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para hacer un negocio de ropa.  El apoyo de este préstamo lo ayudaría en seguir adelante y cuidar a su familia. Su sueno es comprar un terreno y seguir adelante. 

Le gusta jugar el deporte de futbol indor y boli.
texts.en:
Christian Israel is 23 years old. He lives with his wife and their 11-month-old daughter. Christian is a member of the rural communal bank Lucha Para Triunfar. There are 13 members in total, the majority of which work in agriculture. Christian works in agriculture. He makes the purchases and sales of his products in the canton of Ventanas. He is requesting this loan to make a clothing business. The support from this loan will help him to get ahead and care for his family. His dream is to purchase a piece of land and to get ahead. He likes playing the sports of indoor soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: His clothing sales business

loans.name: Joel Eliceo

texts.es:
Joel Eliceo C. V. tiene 19 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios.  

Joel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Joel es comerciante. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. Solicita el credito para aumentar su negocio. Su sueno es seguir trabajando y cuidar a la familia.

Le gusta jugar deportes como indoor futbol y boli.
texts.en:
Joel Eliceo C. V., 19, is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Joel is a member of the Lucha Para Triunfar ("Struggle To Triumph") community bank. Most of the group's 13 members are farmers. Joel, on the other hand, is a merchant. He buys and sells products in Ventanas. He is applying for a loan to stock his business. His dream is to continue working and caring for his family. Joel likes sports, including football and boli.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Victor Alfredo

texts.es:
Victor Alfredo C. V. tiene 24 anos. Vive en union libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios.  

 Victor es un socio de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Victor se dedica a la agricultura. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

El apoyo de esta prestamo lo ayudaria en pagar unas deudas. Su sueno es comprar una propia casa. 

Le gusta jugar deportes como futbol indor y boli.
texts.en:
Victor Alfredo C. V. is 24 years old. He lives with a woman in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. Victor is a member of the rural bank Lucha Para Triunfar. There are 13 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. Victor works in agriculture. He buys and sells his products in the Ventanas canton. The support of this loan would help to ay off some debts. His dream is to buy his own house. He likes sports such as soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his agriculture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses (buy medicines and pay for exminations)

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, tiene 35 años y esta casada con Nildo de 38 años, ambos tienen dos hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia. El motor de su vida, son sus hijos, a quienes quiere brindarles todo lo que ella, no tuvo, por eso con bastante dedicación siembra gladiolo, papa, arveja y maíz. Lleva 10 años trabajando, en compañía de su esposo. Ama la tranquilidad que le brindan los campos, pero le incomoda trasladar sus cosechas hacía el mercado de su ciudad.  Asimismo, considera que las utilidades que le deja su labor agrícola es muy bueno, es por eso tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad porque está segura de poder cuidar adecuadamente sus tierras, además desea comprar un carro para que brinde el servicio de transporte público. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP,  y está muy agradecida por la confianza que le brindan, pues para ella, el crédito significa una oportunidad para salir adelante, además le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá, piensa comprar bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old and is married to Nildo, 38. They have 2 children who live with them in their own house. The driving force in Esther's life is her sons, to whom she wants to give everything that she didn't have. For this reason Esther is very dedicated to her job planting gladioli, potatoes, peas and maize. She has been working with her husband doing this for 10 years. Esther loves the tranquility that the country gives her, but it is an inconvenience for her to transport her harvest to the market in the city. She considers the profits that her agricultural labour gives her are very good, so she has planned to sow a greater quantity of plants because she is sure she will be able to look after them adequately. Esther also wants to purchase a car to provide a public transport service. This is the third loan she has had from MFP and she is very thankful for the confidence that they have shown. For Esther, this loan signifies an opportunity to improve her situation, and she also likes working in her communal bank. With the loan she will receive she will purchase bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertiliser.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es:
Jorge Washington Valverde G. tiene 25 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 1 hijo que se llama Madeli. 

Jorge es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Ventanas. 

Solicita el prestamo para sembrar maiz, que con el prestamo puede seguir adelante conla auyda de Dios. Su sueno es tener buena salud y seguir adelante.  

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo en la casa.
texts.en:
Jorge Washington Valverde G. is 25 years old. He lives with his partner in the canton of Ventanas is the Los Rios province. He has one child named Madeli.

Jorge is a member of the rural communal bank, San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe. There are 13 members in total, the majority of which work in agriculture.

Jorge works in agriculture growing corn. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to plant corn. With the loan the loan, he can continue to get ahead with the help of God. His dream is to have good health and to get ahead.

In his free time he likes spending time at home.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant corn

loans.name: Cléber Eduardo

texts.es:
Cléber Eduardo P. S. tiene 28 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6, y 1 ano. 

Cléber es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Cléber se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el credito para un chanchero. Con el apoyo del credito puede seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Cléber Eduardo P. S. is 28 years old. He is in a common-law marriage, and he lives in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. He has three children; ages 8, 6, and 1. Cléber is a member of the Eraneiseo de Sibimbe Communal Bank. There are 13 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Cléber is a farmer. He is requesting a loan for his pig farm. With the help of the loan he will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his pig farm

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena G. M. tiene 58 anos. Vive con su esposo y sus hijos en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 14 anos. 

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Maria se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el credito para sus siembras en el proximo siglo corto. Con el apoyo del credito quiere seguir adelante y no quedarse en un solo puesto. 

Le gusta pasar tiempo con sus hijos en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena G. M. is 58 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. She has two children, ages 16 and 14. Maria is a member of the San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe Communal Bank. There are 13 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Maria is a farmer. She is requesting the loan for the next short crop cycle. With the help of the loan she wants to get ahead and not stay in just one place. She likes to spend time with her children during her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds for farming

loans.name: Cruz Antonia

texts.es:
Cruz Antonia G. B. tiene 49 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Ventanas en la província de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos de 28 y 8 anos. 

Cruz es una socia de la ventanilla rural San Francisco de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Cruz se dedica a criar pollos. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Solicita el credito para crecer su negocio. Con el apoyo del credito mejorara mas con la ayuda de Dios. Su sueno es seguir su negocio. 

En su tiempo libre cuida y da alimento a sus pollos.
texts.en:
Cruz Antonia G. Brorja is 49 years old. She is in a common-law marriage, and she lives in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. She has two children, ages 28 and 8. Cruz is a member of the San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe Communal Bank. There are 13 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Cruz raises chickens. She makes her purchases and sells her products in Ventanas. She is requesting the loan for her business to grow. With help from the loan and from God, it will improve more. Her dream is to continue her business. In her free time she takes care of and feeds her chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Ericka Delfina

texts.es:
Ericka nació y vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde vive con su esposo y fruto del matrimonio tienen dos hermosos hijos. 

Ericka lleva toda su vida rodeada de panes. Su padre era maestro panadero y se dedicaba a la elaboración de panes en sus dos hornos que están ubicados en el distrito de San Sebastián, cerca de la ciudad del Cusco en Perú. Ericka cuando era niña ayudaba en el horno a su papá y le daba un porcentaje de las ganancias.  Al cumplir la mayoría de edad Ericka, su papá decidió darle para que administre uno de los hornos. 

Decidida a mejorar y administrar el negocio, Ericka al ver que tenía mucha demanda sus ricos panes. Utilizo sus ahorros para abrir una panificadora “El Crocandito” en su domicilio, donde vende panes especiales, bocaditos y tortas. La pueden encontrar en su panificadora, que está equipado algunas vitrinas, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de panes. Ericka desprende una imagen de experiencia y amabilidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su panificadora y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora del desayuno y loche. Ella vende panes de buena calidad y a un costo barato.     
  
Con su próximo préstamo, Ericka espera recibir $400 USD. Por el momento, su panificadora, esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar una vitrina y para comprar los insumos para la elaboración de masa. 
Ericka pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.  El sueño de la socia es abrir otros planificadores “Crocanditos” en la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Ericka was born and lives in Cusco city where she lives with her husband and fruit of their marriage - 2 beautiful children. Ericka has spent her life surrounded by bread. Her father was a master baker and worked making bread in his 2 ovens located in the San Sebastián district, close to Cusco city in Peru. When Ericka was a little girl she used to help her father with the ovens and he used to give her a percentage of his earnings. When Ericka became older her father decided to give her one of the ovens to administer. Determined to improve and administer her business well, Ericka had a lot of demand for her delicious breads. She used her savings to open an industrial bakery 'El Crocandito' in her house, where she sells special breads, snacks and cakes. You can find her in her bakery, which is equipped with various display cases, 7 days a week, from very early until quite late at night or until her supply of bread finishes. Ericka gives off an image of experience and friendliness. A regular flow of customers visit her bakery and the business becomes quite busy during breakfast and lunch hours. Ericka sells good quality bread at a cheap price.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case and ingredients to make dough

loans.name: Ysabel Catalina

texts.es:
Isabel Catalina A. G. tiene 32 anos. Es soltera y vive con sus hijos en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 11, y 9 anos. 

Isabel es una socia de la ventanilla rural San Francisco de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Isabel se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el credito para siembras del siglo corto. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Con el apoyo del prestamo espera seguir adelante con la ayuda de Dios. Su sueno es lograr sus metas y no quedarse en el mismo lugar. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 32 years old, single, and lives with her children in the canton of Ventanas, Los Rios province. She has 4 children, ages 16, 14, 11, and 9. Ysabel is a member of the San Francisco de Sibimbe communal bank, which has 13 members in all, the majority of whom are in agriculture. Ysabel too is in agriculture. She is requesting this loan to sow crops on the short growth cycle. She buys and sells her products in Ventanas. With the help of the loan, Ysabel hopes to forge ahead, with God's help. Her dream is to reach her goals and not remain in the same place. Ysabel likes to spend her free time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: SOWING HER CROPS ON THE SHORT CYCLE

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
Jorge Gómez Díaz se ha vuelto un experto en productos nutricionales, pues es un negoció que desde el año 2007 inició entre vecinos y amigos y que gradualmente le ha agregado artículos de uso diario como calzado electrodomésticos, el   vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla donde confluyen muchas actividades comerciales formales e informales en una zona residencial y donde abundan los mega espacios deportivos como el Estadio metropolitano donde se juega el mejor futbol de Colombia. Jorge Eduardo está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace mas de un año, su credikiva es su segundo crédito, con el comprará productos nutricionales, ropa y calzado que tiene encargada por sus clientes, Desde su crédito anterior su liquidez ha mejorado y ahora tiene para comprar de contado aunque cada día aumentan sus pedidos y siempre quisiera tener un capital guardado para cualquier oportunidad que se le presente pues en su negocio son contantes.
Su sueño y desafío mayor se concentra ahora en tener un punto de venta abierto al público para asesorar personalmente y desde este mismo a muchas personas que desean mejorar sus condiciones nutricionales y exponer todo la mercancía  atractiva que vende
texts.en:
Jorge Gómez Díaz has become an expert on nutritional products. He started his business in 2008 by selling to neighbors and friends, and gradually he added products such as footwear and household appliances. He lives in the "Ciudadela 20 de Julio" neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where there is a convergence of many commercial activities, both formal and informal, in a residential area, and where there are many sporting venues such as the Metropolitan Stadium where they play the best soccer in Colombia. Jorge Eduardo has been involved with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for more than a year. This loan from Kiva will be his second loan. With it he will buy nutritional products, clothing and shoes to fill orders from his customers. Since his first loan, his liquidity has improved and now he has sufficient capital to buy with cash, even though every day his orders increase, and he always wanted to have some capital saved in case an opportunity presents itself, which in his business requires cash. His dream and his main challenge is to have a retail outlet that is open to the public where he can personally advise the many people who want to improve their nutritional conditions and where he can exhibit all of the attractive merchandise that he is selling.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: he will buy nutritional products, clothing and shoes to fill orders from his customers

loans.name: Santiago Desiderio

texts.es:
Santiago Desiderio A. M. tiene 50 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 anos. 

Santiago es socio de la ventanilla rural San Francisco de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Santiago se dedica a la agricultura y al cultivo de cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Solicita el credito para siembras de cacao. Con el apoyo de este prestamo mejorara mas la calidad de sus productos. Su sueno es avanzar en la agricultura y no quedarse en el mismo lugar. 

Le gusta pescar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Santiago Desiderio A. M. is 50 years old. He lives with a woman in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. He has 2 children who are 4 and 6 years old. Santiago is a member of the rural bank San Francisco de Sibimbe. There are 13 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. Santiago works in agriculture and he grows cacao. He buys and sells his products in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan for cacao crops. With the support of this loan he will improve the quality of his products. His dream is to advance in agriculture and not stay in the same place. He likes to fish in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cacao crops

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana nació en la ciudad de Urcos y actualmeente vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde vive con su esposo y sus cuatros hermosos hijos. 

Juana al ver que tenía mucha demanda la leña. Utilizo sus ahorros para abrir un stand en su domicilio, donde vende leña. La pueden encontrar en su puesto, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de leña. Juana desprende una imagen de experiencia y amabilidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su puesto. Ella vende leña seca y a un costo barato. Su esposo Daniel es chofer y tiene su propio taxi y brida servicio de transportes en la ciudad del Cusco.  
     
Con su próximo préstamo, Juana espera recibir $400 USD. Por el momento, su puesto esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar leña y para hacer mantenimientos del taxi.  

Juana pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.  El sueño de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos y construir casa de materia noble.
texts.en:
Juana was born in the city of Urcos, and she now lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and their four beautiful children. Juana saw that there was much demand for firewood. She used her savings to open a stand in her home where she sells firewood. She can be found at her stand seven days a week, from very early until rather late at night or until her supply of firewood is gone. Juana presents an image of experience and friendliness, and a regular flow of customers visits her stand. She sells dry firewood at a low cost. Her husband Daniel is a driver. He has his own taxi and offers transportation services in the city of Cusco. With her next loan, Juana hopes to receive $400 (US). At this time, her stand is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy firewood and to do maintenance on the taxi. Juana belongs to the community bank "El Amanecer" (the dawn). She has participated in the community bank for several loan cycles, and her fellow bank members have reconfirmed their confidence in her. Her dream is for her children to have careers and to build a house of quality materials.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood and do maintenance on the taxi

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es:
Vivian nació el departamento de Apuricma, es soltera y hace 15 años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco. 
 
Vivian utilizo sus ahorros para abrir una librería donde vende útiles escolares. La pueden encontrar en su tienda, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde de la noche.  Vivian desprende una imagen de experiencia y amabilidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su librería “MASTERCOM” que está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq cerca al centro Histórico del Cusco. Ella vende cuadernos, lapiceros, mochilas, etc.  
     
Con su próximo préstamo, Juana espera recibir $600 USD. Por el momento, su tienda esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar papelería, suministros de computadoras, suministros de impresoras como por ejemplo  tintas y tóner 

Vivian pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.  El sueño de la socia es abrir otra tienda y en el centro histórico del Cusco.
texts.en:
Vivian was born in the department of Apuricma. She is single and has lived in the city of Cusco for fifteen years. With savings, Vivian opened a book store where she sells school supplies. You can find her in her store seven days a week, from very early until quite late at night. Vivian projects an image of experience and friendliness. A steady stream of regular customers visits her book store "Mastercom," which is located in the Wauchaq district, near the historic center of Cusco. She sells notebooks, pens, satchels, etc. With her next loan, Vivian hopes to receive $600. At the moment, her store is modestly supplied with basic necessities. She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy stationery, computer supplies, and printing supplies such as inks and toner. Vivian belongs to the communal bank "El Amanecer" (The Dawn). She has had previous loans and has reaffirmed her confidence in her ability to make her payments. The dream of this member is to open another store in the historic center of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stationery, computer supplies, and printing supplies such as ink and toner.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María Soledad vive en el departamento de Cusco junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos. María Soledad abrió una pequeña imprenta, donde hace poster, afiches, almanaques, etc. La pueden encontrar en su puesto, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde de la noche.  María Soledad desprende una imagen de experiencia y profesionalidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su Imprenta. Ella elabora sus productos de buena calidad y a un costo barato.     
     
Con su próximo préstamo, María Soledad espera recibir $700 USD. Por el momento, su imprenta esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo tintas, papeles, cartulinas, etc.  

María Soledad pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.
texts.en:
María Soledad lives in the Cusco district with her husband and two children. María Soledad opened a small printing press where she makes posters, prints, calendars, etc. You can find her at work seven days a week from early in the morning until late at night. María Soledad projects an image of experience and professionalism. A regular flow of customers visits her press. She makes high quality products at a low cost. With her next loan, María Soledad hopes to receive $700 USD. For the moment, her press is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would like to use the loan to purchase more materials such as inks, papers, cards, etc. María Soledad belongs to the communal bank El Almanecer, or ‘Dawn.’ She has participated in the communal bank for several loan cycles, which have reaffirmed her confidence to take out loans.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as inks, papers, cards, etc.

loans.name: Judith Genoveva

texts.es:
Judith vive en el departamento de Cusco junto con su único hijo. Judith es una mujer responsable y emprendedora pues es docente y trabaja en la ONG “Inca Educa”. Judith también se dedica hacer manualidades en sus horas libres como por ejemplo muñequería, etc. Hace varios años su marido la abandono por otra mujer, y Judith se quedo sola al cuidado de su hijo. 

Decidida a empezar una vida, Judith utilizo sus ahorros para abrir un taller de manualidades en su domicilio. Con su próximo préstamo, Judith espera recibir $600 USD. Por el momento, su taller esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar materiales como papeles, colores y para el gasto personal. 

Judith pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.
texts.en:
Judith lives in the department of Cusco with her only child. Judith is responsible and enterprising as she is teaching and works for the NGO (non-governmental organization) "Inca Educa." She also makes handicrafts in her spare time, such as dolls, etc. Several years ago her husband left her for another woman, and Judith has remained alone, caring for her boy. Deciding to start a new life, Judith used savings to open a handicrafts workshop in her residence. With her next loan, she hopes to receive $600. At the moment, her workshop is modestly equipped with basic necessities. She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy materials such as paper, colored pencils and for personal expenses. Judith belongs to the communal bank "El Amanecer" (The Dawn). She has already repaid several loans and has reaffirmed her confidence in the benefits of the loans and her ability to make her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make handicrafts and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia, es una carismática, mujer de 59 años, que está casada con Felipe de 69 años, ambos tiene dos hijos mayores, quienes trabajan de manera independiente y viven en la ciudad de Lima, por lo que está pareja viven solos en su casa propia. Desde hace 37 años, cultiva café, plátano, tangerina y achiote, en terrenos que posee, en donde su esposo, la ayuda en el trabajo, pero cuando tiene que requerir de mayor esfuerzo y tiempo, contrata operarios. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es vivir en el campo, disfruta del campo, la tranquilidad que le brinda y sentir la naturaleza. Por otro lado el tener que trasladar su cosecha a la ciudad le resulta difícil por la distancia, pero asegura que vale la pena, porque las utilidades que consigue, son bastante considerables y le permiten cubrir sus primeras necesidades. Ahora que el kilo de café lo están cotizando a S/. 8.00 soles el kilo, desea incrementar su producción de de este producto que es muy requerido en los mercados y en los centros de acopio. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y esta segura que pagará puntualmente, sus cuotas como hasta ahora, además esta feliz de trabajar con las personas de su grupo comunal a quienes aprecia. Con el crédito comprará,  varios sacos de abono orgánico, el cual esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de café y plátano.
texts.en:
Felicia is a charismatic 59 year old woman. She is married to Felipe, who is 69. They have two grown children who work independently and live in the city of Lima, so the couple lives alone in their own home. For 37 years, she has grown coffee, plantains, tangerines and annato on the land that she owns. Her husband helps her with the work, but when it requires more effort and time, she hires laborers. What she likes the most is living in the country, enjoying the country and the tranquility it brings, and feeling nature. On the other hand, having to transport her harvest to the city is difficult for her because of the distance, but she assures us that it is worth it because the earnings she makes are considerable and they allow her to cover her basic neccessities. Now that coffee is at S/. 8.00 soles a kilo, she want to increase her production of that product that is very much in demand in the makets and stockpiling centers. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is sure that she will make her payments on time as she has so far. She is also happy to work with the people in her community group, whom she appreciates. With the loan, she will buy various bags of organic fertilizer, which she will spread on her coffee and plantain plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer to improve the production of plantains and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses (investing in the business that he has, buying basic grains, oil, chicken, snacks, etc.)

loans.name: Neyler

texts.es:
Neyler vive en la provincia de Urubamba junto con su esposa y fruto de este matrimonio tiene dos hermosos hijos. Neyler es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor pues siempre está trabajando y así es la única forma de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Neyler abrió una pequeña tienda que estaba ubicado en la ciudad de Urubamba,  donde vendía muebles y colchones. Hace 10 años se puso mal de la columna y tuvo que dejar de trabajar, Su esposa Gladys  tuvo que asumir los gastos de la familia, ella se dedica  a la venta zapatos, zapatillas y ropa de segundo uso llamada comúnmente por la gente “Ropa Americana”.
 
Actualmente Neyler se encuentra recuperado y mejor. Utilizo sus ahorros para abrir otro negocio en el mismo lugar donde vendía muebles y ahora vende zapatillas de marca.  Neyler  se dedica a este negocio porque hay demanda y porque la gente gasta dinero al viajar a la ciudad de Cusco a comprar zapatillas de marca. Le pueden encontrar en su tienda, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Neyler desprende una imagen de amabilidad y alegría. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su tienda porque vende productos de calidad y a costos razonables.     
     
Con su próximo préstamo, Neyler espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su tienda  esta modestamente equipado con mercadería necesaria.  El va emplear el dinero del préstamo para pagar los impuestos en la frontera de Chile y Perú de las zapatillas que compro de ese país.  

Neyler pertenece al banco comunal  “Señor de Torrechayoc” y es socio nuevo y es la primera vez que participa en el banco comunal pues su esposa Gladys le invito.
texts.en:
Neyler lives in the province of Urubamba together with his wife and with their two beauitiful children. Neyler is a hard working man and he worked all the time so that he could provide his children with a better quality of life. Neyler opened a small store in Urubamba where he sold furniture and matresses. But 10 years ago he started to have back problems and he was forced to stop working. His wife Gladys took over having to provide for the family's expenses. She sells mens and ladies' shoes and second-hand clothing, popularly named by the public "American Clothes". Neyler is recovering and is doing better. He used his savings to open another business in the same locale where he used to sell furniture but now he sells name-brand ladies' shoes. Neyler started this business given the great demand. Visitors to Cusco spend their money to purchase name-brand ladies' shoes. He can be found in his store all 7 days of the week, from 9 in the morning until 8 at night. Neyler always portrays an image of kindness and happiness. A regular flow of clients visits his store because he sells quality products at reasonable prices. He wishes to receive a loan of S/.1500 nuevos soles. Currently his store is modestly stocked with merchandise. He will use the funds to pay the import taxes from Chile and Peru, countries where he purchases the shoes. Neyler is a new member of the Community Bank "Senor de Torrehchayoc". It is the first time that he takes part in the Community Bank, following an invitation from his wife, Gladys.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the import taxes from Chile and Peru

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina nació en Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus hijos. Cristina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues siempre está trabajando y así es la única forma D. darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos. Cristina en el año 1974 abrió un pequeño puesto en el mercado central D. la ciudad D. Urubamba, donD. vendía abarrotes  y verduras. En el Año 1990 motivado por su esposo se arriesgo para vender carne en el mismo puesto D. venta y por el momento le va muy bien. Cristina también tiene un su domicilio una tienda D. abarrotes y un restaurante “El Descanso”. El restaurante  estuvo cerrado por varios meses pero ahora por el mes D. agosto abrirá D. nuevo y contratara una persona para que atienda el negocio. El motivo D. la reapertura es porque cerca D. su casa están haciendo una obra y los trabajadores necesitaran almuerzo. 
  
Con su próximo préstamo, Cristina espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básica. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para implementar el restaurante y comprar gaseosas e insumos.   

Cristina pertenece al banco comunal  “Señor D. Torrechayoc” y es socia fundadora. DesD. el año 1994 que se abrió el banco comunal, ella sigue participando y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado D. la ciudad D. Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in Urubamba, an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco where she currently lives with her husband and children. Cristina is an enterprising woman who is always working hard as she believes this is the only way to give her children a better quality of life. In 1974, Cristina opened a small stall in the central market of Urubamba where she sold groceries and vegetables. In 1990, motivated by her husband, she ventured into the sale of meat at the same market stall and for the moment, she is doing very well. Cristina also runs a grocery store from her home and a restaurant called “El Descanso”. The restaurant was closed for several months but it will re-open in August and she will hire someone to look after the business. The reason for re-opening the store is because they are doing construction work near her home and the workers will need lunch. With her next loan, Cristina hopes to receive S/. 1500 nuevos solos. For the moment, her restaurant is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would like to use the money from the loan to equip the restaurant and buy sodas and supplies. Cristina belongs to the “Señor D. Torrechayoc” communal bank which she herself founded in 1994. She continues to participate and the group is doing very well. The communal bank was named in honor of the patron saint of Urubamba in whom all the members have faith.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip the restaurant and purchase sodas and supplies.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 31 años y vive con su esposo Hernán de 34 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos pequeños y hermosos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en un pueblo tranquilo llamado “Patay”. Desde hace 11 años, ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, siembra papa, arveja, gladiolos y habas  en sus terrenos propios, paralelamente cría caballos que le ayudan a trasladar los insumos y herramientas agrícolas hacia las chacras,  además tiene vacas que le brindan a diario litros de leche, en donde luego elabora quesos, que son vendidos en las tiendas y sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta a Haydee, es sembrar arvejas y flores, porque son productos muy solicitados en el mercado, ya que al comercializarlos le resulta bastante rentable, debido a que las utilidades las vuelve a invertir en sus sembríos y puede cubrir sus gastos familiares, por eso planea sembrar en mayor cantidad, porque sabe que tendrá mejores oportunidades para el bienestar de sus hijos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y está segura de poder pagarlo puntualmente, ya que para ella, el crédito significa una oportunidad para salir y porque le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y dos bolsas de semilla de arveja, como usualmente lo hace en cada siembra.
texts.en:
Haydee is 31 years old and she lives with her husband Hernan, 34, and they have 2 beautiful little children. They live in their own home located in a quiet village called Patay. Since she was 11 years old she has been a dedicated agriculturer, sowing potatoes, peas, gladiola flowers and fava beans. They have their own fields. In addition they have a stable where they grow horses that help them transport their tools and products to the fields. They also have cows that give them various litres of milk every day with which they make cheeses destined for sale in stores and to their neighbours. Haydee's favorite thing to do is to sow peas and flowers because they are the products that are most sought out in the markets and the sales are very profitable. She is able to reinvest in her plantations while managing to cover the family's expenses. She plans on expanding her plantation so that she will be able to provide her children with better opportunities for her children. This is the fourth loan she seeks with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed this process. A loan is the means to have an opportunity to advance and She enjoys working in a group. With the loan she is requesting she would like to purchase several sacks of organice fertilizer and two sacks of pea seeds, as she usually purchases every year.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers and pea seeds.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia nació en la ciudad de Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su hijo Manuel. Alicia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues siempre está trabajando y así es la única forma de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Alicia es profesora y trabajo en varios colegios como “La Salle” y otros. Actualmente, Alicia trabaja en el colegio “Jesús Lambarry” en la comunidad de Huallocari de Urubamba. Alicia también participa en un teatro “Cusi Wasi”. Ya son 6 años que participa en el teatro y le va muy bien. Hace tres años su pareja la abandono por otra mujer, y se quedo sola al cuidado de su hijo de cuatro años. 
	
Decidida a empezar nueva vida, busco mas oportunidad de trabajo y sus compañeros del teatro le motivaron para que pueda confeccionar disfraces y vestimentas típicas de la región. Ella actualmente tiene varias vestimentas que alquila a los integrantes del teatro y al público en general. Un flujo regular de clientes la buscan para alquilar sus trajes de danzas. 
   
Con su próximo préstamo, Alicia espera recibir S/. 1700 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su taller de confección esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básica. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, hilos, botones y muchas cosas más.

Alicia pertenece al banco comunal  “Señor de Torrechayoc”. En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal pero Alicia, participa desde hace dos ciclos atrás y le va muy bien. El nombre que le pusieron al banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Alicia was born in the city of Urubamba, which is one hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco. She lives in that same city with her son, Manuel. Alicia is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is always working. That is the only way to give her son a better quality of life. Alicia is a teacher, and she has worked in several schools like La Salle and others. Alicia currently teaches at the Jesús Lambarry School in the Huallocari community in Urubamba. Alica also participates in the Cusi Wasi Theater. She has participated in the theater for six years, and it is going very well for her. Her life partner abandoned her for another woman three years ago. She was left alone to take care of her four year old son. Determined to start a new life, she looked for more work opportunities. Her theater colleagues encouraged her to make costumes and typical regional clothes. She currently has several garments that she rents to the members of the theater and the general public. A regular flow of customers seek her out to rent her dance outfits. With her next loan Alicia hopes to receive 1,700 soles. Presently her shop is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. She would use the money from the loan to buy materials like fabric, thread, buttons, a lots of other things. Alicia belongs to the Señor de Torrechayor Communal Bank. This Communal Bank started in 1994, and Alicia has been participating for two cycles. It is going very well for her. The name of the Communal Bank is a tribute to the patron saint of the city of Urubamba. All of the members have faith in him.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like fabric, thread, buttons, a lots of other things

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys nació en Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con esposo y sus dos hijos. Gladys es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues siempre está trabajando y así es la única forma de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Hace varios años atrás Gladys vendía muebles en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo pero le fue muy mal. 

Decidida a  empezar una nueva vida, Gladys se dedico a la venta de ropa en la ciudad de Urubamba, donde vende ropa de segunda uso, comúnmente llamada por la gente  “Ropa Americana”. Hace 2 años que  se dedica al negocio y le va muy excelente. Le pueden encontrar en su negocio, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta bastante tarde en la  noche.    

Con su próximo préstamo, Alicia espera recibir S/. 2000 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su tienda esta modestamente equipado con mercadería surtida. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar más ropa de segundo uso.

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc”.  pero Gladys, participa desde hace dos ciclos atrás y le va muy bien. El nombre que le pusieron al banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba pues todos los socios le tienen fe.
texts.en:
Gladys was born in the city of Urubamba, which is one hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco. She lives in that same city with her husband and their two children. Gladys is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is always working. That is the only way to give her children a better quality of life. Several years ago Gladys sold furniture in the city of Ollantaytambo. That went very poorly for her. Determined to start a new life, Gladys started selling clothes in the city of Urubamba. She sells second hand clothes, which the people commonly call American clothes. She has been doing this for two years, and it is going extremely well for her. You can find her in her business seven days of the week from nine in the morning until pretty late at night. With her next loan Gladys hopes to receive 2,000 soles. Presently her store is modestly equipped with stocked merchandise. She would use the money from the loan to buy second hand clothes. Gladys belongs to the Señor de Torrechayor Communal Bank. This Communal Bank started in 1994, and Gladys has been participating for two cycles. It is going very well for her. The name of the Communal Bank is a tribute to the patron saint of the city of Urubamba. All of the members have faith in him.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more second had clothes

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 43 años, vive con su pareja Leonidas, de 69 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos,  pero sólo vive en su casa propia con dos de ellos, pues el mayor ya tiene su propia familia. Cada mañana para ella, empieza un nuevo día lleno de retos, ya que la arveja, habas, papa, maíz, avena y gladiolos, son los productos que siembra desde hace 20 años, junto a su esposo, pues para ambos su prioridad es cubrir los gastos domésticos y  la educación de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta a Lidia, es cosechar papa y arveja porque son los frutos que mayor demanda tienen en el mercado de su ciudad, las cuales le dejan ganancias considerables y seguras porque tiene comerciantes mayoristas, quienes conoce la calidad de sus productos y no dudan en comprar su mercadería. Como sus ingresos son rentables, desea en adelante sembrar en mayor cantidad papa, arveja y gladiolo. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta contenta de laborar en su grupo comunal, con las personas, que considera responsables, honestos y solidarios. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de guano de ave de corral, para sembrar en la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Lidia is 43 years old, and she lives with her 69 year husband, Leonidas. They have three children, but only two of them live with them in their own house. The oldest has his own family. Every morning she starts a new day filled with challenges. Peas, beans, potatoes, corn, oats, and gladiolas are the products that she has been planting with her husband for 20 years. The priority for both of them is to cover the household expenses and their children’s education. What Lidia likes the most is harvesting the potatoes and peas because there is a greater demand for them in the city’s market. They give them a sizable and secure income because the wholesale merchants know the quality of their products, and they do not hesitate to buy their merchandise. As their income from the crops is profitable, she wishes to plant a greater quantity of potatoes, peas, and gladiolas. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is happy working with her communal bank. The people are responsible, honest, and supportive. She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of poultry guano for the next season’s planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of poultry guano

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials (zinc, wood, screws, plastic)

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot de 31años,  es una mujer bastante trabajadora, está casada con Elmer de 36 años con quien tiene 2 hijos que son su adoración, ellos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 13 años, siembra junto a su esposo arveja, papa, gladiolos de color blanco y rojo,  en sus terrenos propios, paralelamente a este trabajo, también se dedica a criar asnos, que le ayudan a trasladar las herramientas que necesitará en la chacra, lugar donde trabaja. Los días martes y domingos, su pareja trabaja brindando servicio de transporte publico. Margot, asegura que gracias a su trabajo en la chacra pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar su vehículo, que además la ayuda a trasladar su cosecha al mercado. Le gusta vender sus frutos por kilos, porque dice que gana más, empleando un poco más de tiempo. Para el futuro piensa  sembrar en mayor cantidad y ahorrar hasta contar con un capital de trabajo algo elevado, para invertirlo en algún negocio, que sea rentable. Este es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y siempre hasta hoy trabaja de manera activa dentro de su grupo comunal, porque le gusta mucho compartir con los demás. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de una bolsa y media de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Margot is 31 years old and she is a very hard working person. She is married with Elmer, 36, and together they have 2 children that are the objects of their adoration. They live in their own home. Since she was 13 years old she has been an agriculturer, sowing peas, potatoes, and white and red gladiola flowers. She plants in their own fields. In addition to this work she also has a stable breeding donkeys that help them transport tools and such to the fields where they work. On Tuesdays and Sundays her husband works as a driver. Margot says that it is thanks to her work in the fields that she has managed to save enough to purchase a car that will also help them transport the harvest to the markets. She prefers to sell her products by the kilo because she says she earns more money that way, though it takes more time. In the future she hopes to expand her plantations and save enough to form a larger working capital fund, to reinvest in some type of profitable business. This is the fourth loan that she has sought from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and to date she has always been active in her community group. She very much enjoys participating with others. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of a one and a half sacs of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra Lizeth M. G. tiene 32 años de edad, reside en la Comunidad de Telica Abajo a 40 minutos de Juticalpa, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Tiene un pequeña venta de abarroteria en su casa de habitacion, la cual atiende ella sola de Lunes a Domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. Sandra comenzo este negocio dado a que frecuentemente tenia que viajar hasta Juticalpa a comprar en una bodega la provision de alimentos para su hogar y como siempre mantenia un buen inventario de productos sus vecinos le iban a quitar prestado alguno de estos y luego de un tiempo se los devolvian, asi que se le ocurrio que en vez de prestarselos se los podia vender.
texts.en:
Sandra Lizeth M. G. is 32 years old and she lives in the community of Telica Abajo, about 40 minutes from Juticalpa. She is a single mother of 3 children. She runs a small conveninece store from her home, managing it on her own 7 days a week from 6 in the morning to 9 at night. Sandra started her business because she found herself having to travel frequently to Juticalpa to purchase groceries for their home. She always kept her pantry well stocked and her neighbours used to always come to borrow products from her. She thought of the business this way, so instead of lending out the products she now sells them.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general grocery items.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia pertenece al Banco Comunal Bonanza hace 5 años y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles.
Teodosia es viuda y tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales una ya es profesional y trabaja, Teodosia venD. leña en su casa, productos que adquiere D. los productores que le traen hasta su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Teodosia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles para la compra leña.
Teodosia sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos tengan un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Teodosia has been a member of the Community Bank Bonanza for the past 5 years and she really appreciates the easy loan process. Teodosia is a widow and she has 7 children, of whom one already has a career and is working. Teodosia sells firewood from her home. She acquires her product from producers that deliver to her house. She works at this business every day. Teodosia requires a loan in the amount of 3000 soles to purchase more firewood. Teodisia dreams of improving her business and she dreams of seeing her children running their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy zinc, blocks, cement, nails, planks,  hammers, sand, beams, and labor

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban nació en Urubamba a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposa y sus hijos. Esteban y su esposa tienen una tienda de abarrotes y un restaurante. El restaurante “El Descanso” estuvo cerrado por varios meses pero ahora por el mes de agosto lo abrirán de nuevo y contrataran una persona para que atienda el negocio. El motivo de la reapertura es que cerca de su casa están haciendo una obra y los trabajadores necesitaran comer. 
  
Con su próximo préstamo, Esteban espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básica. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para implementar el restaurante y comprar gaseosas e insumos.   

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc”, pero Esteban participa desde que se abrió el banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre que le pusieron al banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Esteban was born in Urubamba, an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco and currently lives there with his wife and children. Esteban and his wife have a grocery shop and restaurant. “El Descanso” (Relaxation) has been closed for several months, but they will open it again in August and hire someone to assist with the business. The reason for reopening is that there is some work going on near his house, and the workers will need to eat.

Esteban hopes to receive 1500 new soles in with his next loan. At present, his restaurant is modestly equipped with the most basic necessities. He would like to use the money from the loan to start up the restaurant and but sofy drinks and other materials.

The “Señor de Torrechayoc” communal bank opened in 1994. Esteban participated from the time it opened and things have gone well. The name given to the communal bank is in honor of the patron saint of the city of Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to open his restaurant and purchase soft drinks and other materials.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, tiene 31 años, es una mujer luchadora y con muchos sueños por cumplir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Teofilo de 34 años y sus 3 hijos, que son la razón de su vida. Junto a su esposo, lleva 14 años sembrando papa, flor de gladiolo, arveja y maíz, en sus terrenos propios y arrendados. En épocas de cosecha contrata operarios para agilizar sus labores, pero siempre está pendiente del buen cuidado de sus tierras, ya que le gusta sembrar arveja y flor de gladiolo, productos de mayor demanda en los mercados de su ciudad. Por otro lado le incomoda retirar la mala hierba que invade sus chacras, pero como es necesario que sus terrenos estén limpios emplea un poco más de tiempo. Estos últimos meses su esposo ha aprendido a fabricar puertas ventanas y demás muebles de metal, pues es muy rentable este negocio. Por eso ambos desean instalar un taller de metalurgia en un espacio de su casa, también quiere abrir un negocio de venta de comestibles, pero sin dejar de lado la agricultura. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y le confiesa que le gusta mucho trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque labora con personas responsables, honestas y trabajadoras como ella. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que utilizará para esparcirlo en sus sembríos de arveja y papa.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old. She is a fighter with a lot of dreams. She lives in her own house together with her 34-year-old husband, Teofilo, and their three children, who are her reason for living. Together with her husband, she has spent the last 14 years growing potatoes, gladiolas, peas, and corn on their own property as well as rented land. During harvest time, the couple contracts operators to speed up the work, but Nancy is always responsible for taking care of the land since she likes to plant peas and gladiolas, two products in high demand at her local markets. It inconveniences her to pull out the bad grass that invades her farm land but she takes the extra time to do so since it is necessary to keep the land clean. These past few months, Nancy's husband has learned to make doors, windows, and metal furniture, which is a very profitable business. For this reason, the couple wants to install a metallurgy shop in their home. Nancy also wants to open a business selling non-perishable foods while still tending to her agricultural projects. This is Nancy's fourth loan with MFP. She says she enjoys working with a community brink because she works with responsible, honest, hard-working people like herself. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of various sacks of organic fertilizer to spread amongst her pea and potato plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva nació en distrito de Quillabamba de la provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco, y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba junto con esposo y sus dos hijos. Elva es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues siempre está trabajando y pues es la única forma de darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Elva es profesora y trabaja en el colegio “2058 de Chichubamba”. El colegio está ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba. 

Decidida a mejorar su vida, Elva abrió una granja donde cría animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas y también se dedica a la venta de productos secos como por ejemplo trigo, papa, maíz. Hace varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Elva espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Por el momento. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar pollos.

En el año 1994 se abrió el banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc”, pero Elva, participa desde hace 12 años y le va muy bien. El nombre que le pusieron al banco comunal es en homenaje al patrón jurado de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Elva was born in the district of Quillabamba in the province of Convención, department of Cusco. Presently, she lives in Urubamba with her husband and two children. Elva is an enterprising woman who is always working hard as she believes this is the only way to give her children a better quality of life. She is a teacher at the “2058 de Chichubamba” school which is located 10 minutes from the city or Urubamba. Deciding to improve her quality of life, Elva started a farm where she raises small animals such as guinea pigs and hens and also sells dry goods like wheat, potatoes, and corn. She has had her business for several years and it is going really well thanks to the determination that she puts into her work. With her next loan, Elva hopes to receive S/. 800 nuevos soles. She would like to use the money to buy chickens. The “Señor de Torrechayoc” comunal bank opened in 1994, but Elva has been participating for the past 12 years and the group is doing very well. The communal bank was named in honor of the patron saint of Urubamba.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Marizol Albina

texts.es:
Marizol pertenece al Banco Comunal Bonanza hace 2 años y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad del préstamo.
Marizol vive en la casa de sus suegros, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años, Marisol vende quesos que compra de los intermediarios, sus productos los vende de casa en casa y tiendas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Marizol solicita un préstamo de 900 soles en la compra de quesos.
Marizol sueña con mejorar su negocio y comprar un terreno para la construcción de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marizol has belonged to the community bank Bonanza for the past two years. What pleases her most is the facility of obtaining a loan. Marizol lives in her in-laws' house with her husband and two children, aged 2 and 6. Marizol sells cheese she buys from middle-men from her home and direct to stores. She works every day. Marizol is asking for a loan of 900 soles for the purchase of chesse. She dreams of improving her business and buying a piece of land where she can build her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de papa en terrenos propios, sus productos los venden en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades los lleva a la ciudad de Lima, dependiendo de la producción.
Irene es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza y lo que mas le agrada son la facilidad de los prestamos y la puntualidad. Solicita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono.
Irene sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa de material noble porque la que tiene es de material rustico.
texts.en:
Irene and her husband work in agriculture, growing potatoes on their land. They sell the potatoes at a wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho and sometimes even sell them in Lima, depending on the production. Irene is married and has four children in school. She is a member of the community bank Bonanza, and what pleases her most are the ease and punctuality of loans. She is asking for a loan of 600 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer. Irene dreams of her children becoming professionals and constructing a house of durable material because hers is very rustic.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Damiana viaja a la comunidad de Alpachaca que se encuentra a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho de donde compra quesos de los productores para luego venderlos en la ciudad de casa en casa, también lleva al distrito de Pacaycasa y además vende alimento para animales que compra en los molinos, Damiana es viuda y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella, Damiana es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones de salud, Damiana necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de  quesos.
Sus sueños son ahorrar para la vejez y adquirir propiedades que le den seguridad para el futuro.
texts.en:
Damiana travels to the community Alpachaca, located three hours from Ayacucho, to buy cheese from local producers, which she then sells from door-to-door in her hometown as well as the district of Pacaycasa. Damiana also sells food for animals, which she buys from the mills. Damiana is a widow with six children, one of whom lives with her. She has been a member of the community bank Bonanza for the past year, and what pleases her most is the health training. Damiana needs a loan of 900 soles, money she will invest in the purchase of cheese. Her dreams are saving money for old age and acquiring property that will offer her security in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cheese

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza hace 3 años y aprendió a tener una buena atención a sus clientes.
Juana es casada y tiene 4 hijos que ya viven fuera D. casa, Juana junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en su casa en donD. venden abarrotes en general, helados, actividad que realiza todos los días. Juana solicita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Juana sueña con tener lo necesario para vivir tranquila.
texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the community bank Bonanza for the past three years. She has learned good customer service skills. Juana is married and has four children who live outsiD. the home. Juana and her husband have a store in their home where they sell groceries and ice cream. They work every day. Juana is asking for a loan of 1050 soles, money she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil. Juana dreams of having what she needs to live peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly C. M., se desempeña hace tres años labores como confecciones de chompas para niños y adultos, uniformes escolares, chalinas, gorras y otras prendas de temporada, todo a base de tejidos de lana e hilo, dichas prendas se elaboran con maquinas de tejer. 

 Para complementar su habilidad y  mejorar su producto se preparó en la CETPRO San Juan Bautista con el objetivo de especializarse más en el rubro, para así obtener mayores ingresos y solventar los gastos de su hogar con el apoyo de su esposo, quien provee otro ingreso en su hogar, además comprar materiales de trabajo, comparte , Magaly también se dedica a vender pasteles, bocaditos, chocolates para eventos especiales como cumpleaños, quince años, bautizos, etc; así fue como logró comprar una  máquina de tejer mas renovada..
Actualmente ahorra dinero para comprar materiales de trabajo (hilo, agujas, lana de colores, etc), y asi seguir esforzándose para adquirir 02 maquinas mas que le es indispensable para elaborar sus tejidos. El préstamo que necesita es para invertir en la compra de materiales de trabajo y pagar algunas deudas pendientes.
texts.en:
Magaly C. M. has worked three years making sweaters for adults and children, school uniforms, scarves, hats, and other seasonal items. Everything is done in wool or linen fabric and made on a sewing machine. To improve her skills and better her product, Magaly studied at the CETPRO San Juan Bautista with the objective of specializing in the field so she could make more money. This would allow her to settle household expenses along with her husband, who provides the household's other source of income, as well as buy necessary materials for her work. Magaly also sells cakes, sandwiches, and chocolates for special events like birthday parties, quinceañeras, baptisms, etc. Through her catering business she was able to buy a better sewing machine. Currently, Magaly is saving money to buy materials for sewing (thread, needles, colored wool, etc.) so she can continue striving to obtain two additional sewing machines needed to make her fabrics. The loan she needs is for the purchase of work materials and paying off some outstanding debt.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials to make fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to invest in a new roof for his house, to plaster some walls in his house, and for other personal expenses

loans.name: Miskyunu-Phiry Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción” actualmente se encuentra en el VII ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la casa D. la socia Florentina que está ubicado en la comunidad D. Phiry, Ollantaytambo. La comunidad D. Phiry se encuentra a dos horas D. la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría D. los pobladores se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería.

Soledad, tiene 25 años y tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo y actualmente vive en la comunidad D. Phiry. Hace ocho años atrás, Soledad abrió un restaurante, en su domicilio, donD. venD. comida a sus vecinos. Soledad también se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes pero para consumo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Soledad espera recibir S/. 300 soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente implementado con las necesidades básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. El sueño D. la socia es convertirse en una prospera empresaria y desea abrir varios restaurantes en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo.

Soledad es una D. las socias fundadoras del banco comunal y la escogieron como la secretaria porque es una persona puntual y responsable. Ya son varias veces que está en el cargo y le va muy bien gracias al carisma y buena voluntad que tiene.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Women in Action" are currently on their 7th loan cycle. The group is maD. up of very hard working individuals that are always on the lookout for opportunities for success. With their daily efforts they hope to proviD. a better future for their children. The Community Bank meetings are held every 30 days in the home of Florentina, a member of the bank, located in the community of Phiry, Ollantaytambo. The community of Phiry is located 2 hours from the city of Cusco. The majority of the population are farmers. Soledad is 25 yaers old and she has a won. She was born in the city of Ollantaytambo but she currently lives in the community of Phiry. Eight years ago Soledad opened a restaurant in her house where she sells foods to her neighbours. Soledad also raises livestock such as guinea pigs, for consumption. The loan she has requested is in the amount of S/300 soles. At the moment her restaurant is modestly stocked with the basic necessities. She would like to invest the funds to purchase ingredients such as rice, sugar, spaghetti and various other items. The dream of this member is to become a successful business woman and would like to operate several franchise locales in the city of Ollantaytambo. Soledad is one of the founding members of this Community Bank and she has been elected as secretary of the group because she is very punctual and responsible. She has been in this position various times before and it has worked out very well thanks to her charisma and positive outlook.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as rice, sugar, pasta and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To carry out home improvements.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo L. Jr. is from the village of Liloan, Bonifacio. He is 29 years old and is married with one infant child.

Romeo owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Romeo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:

Emma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo P. is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old and is single. Primo works in someone else's business providing habal-habal (motorcycle) transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Primo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Primo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair the engine of his motorcycle. This loan will be his ninth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
